story:
Never Again

With the introduction of Mac OS X 10.9 (Mavericks), the hardy ol' MT-NewsWatcher Usenet app stopped working.  There are sparse pickings for anyone looking for a similar, native, non-commercial newsreader for the Mac.  We're not happy about that at Subsume Technologies, so we started to develop a new app that will not only bring Usenet back to Mac users, but push it back into being as mainstream as Mail.  With your help, we can make it happen.

What Is Usenet?

For the newcomers, Usenet can be thought of as the original social network.  It's a way to get people together to discuss topics of interest.  But there's no single "site" you go to.  It sort of works like email, where anybody who is connected can talk with anyone else.  You can dig into the details of Usenet on Wikipedia.

What Is Signal?

Signal is a new Usenet newsreader we've started to develop.  It will be built; it's already being built.  What we're hoping to accomplish in this campaign is to turn it from commercial software that you buy from the App Store to a (possibly) open source project that can be used and extended for all sorts of different applications.

Why Call It Signal?

The name is inspired by a quote in the movie Serenity set in the Firefly universe: "You can't stop the signal, Mal."  The icon is inspired by the interference pattern created in a double-slit experiment, which we think is an apt representation for not just Usenet, but social networks in general.

Who We Are

Subsume Technologies, Inc. has been doing Objective-C development since before Apple bought NeXT.  Please visit our site to see more about what we do.  If you're already on Usenet (by whatever means), we'll also be discussing Signal in the comp.sys.mac.* newsgroups; look for us there.

Our Main Goal

With $20K of funding, we can cover the development costs for Signal 1.0.0 (and some subsequent updates).  The target feature set for the initial version is:

  • Participation in discussion-based newsgroups
  • Content filtering (similar to Rules in Mail)
  • Read/write the common document formats: .newsrc, NZB, MIME messages
  • A separate NNTP framework that makes it easier for other developers to tap into Usenet

In return for the support you show now, we would then make the app available for FREE on the App Store (and our site, and anywhere else that wants to offer it). For those familiar with Usenet folklore, setting our initial target date as September was not done by accident.

Our Stretch Goal

With $50K of funding, we can turn Signal into an ongoing open sourced project.  To avoid licensing hassles, we are expecting to put everything into the public domain.  In addition, we would target the following features for the 2.0.0 version:

  • Participation in file-based newsgroups (aka, alt.binaries.*)
  • Expand the viewer to support other protocols (e.g., Mail, RSS, Jabber, Twitter, etc.)
  • Add support for iOS
  • Expand the model to support a local message database

Perk Goals

Other features may be added or enhanced based on feedback or funding.  If you have an immediate need for localization or a tri-paned view like Mail or any other special consideration, you really should get in at a higher funding level so we can better address those needs for you.

Collective Perks

We appreciate that you can share this campaign with others.  As a reward for referring other contributors, we will award you perks based on all the contributions you bring in.  So tell 10 or 100 or 1000 of your closest friends and you may just get yourself a custom app to collect and distribute your citizen scientist data via Usenet (or whatever it is your heart desires).

Contact Us First for Custom Perks

Any funding at the $1000 level or above will require an agreement that the desired result is covered by the corresponding perk.  Please be sure to let us know what you want before you commit the money.  And be aware that the back-and-forth discussion will take some time, so don't wait until the last minute to start arrangements!

story:
Introducing Magic Holder, the ultimate wireless portable charger that combines all desired functions. It has an infrared sensor that recognizes and automatically opens and retracts the silicon rubber lined grips to securely cradle your phone in place during charging. It can offer fast wireless and wired charges to 3 devices simultaneously, and can be conveniently recharged by directly plugging into the wall through its built-in wall plug. It has a hidden camera detector and a flashlight to use for traveling or camping. It boasts other features which make it the perfect companion for digital nomads to stay charged and productive on the move.

 

 

 

 

Thanks to its infrared sensor, simply put your device close to Magic Holder and the clamps will open instantly for your phone to be placed on the charging pad and will close to a custom fit to keep your phone fixed and charged whether you put them in your bag, carry them on the go, answer phone calls, play games or watch videos.

 

Note: Clamps are compatible with mobile devices with a width of 2.5” to 3.6” (65 to 91mm).

Magic Holder provides safe and reliable charging without the hassle of cables up to 10W for Android, 7.5W for iPhone, and 5W for standard wireless charging speed. It is compatible with all Qi-enabled devices.

 

Magic Holder is also a large capacity 10000mAh Li-ion power bank which delivers wired charges through its PD 18W USB-C and QC3.0 USB-A dual outputs. It keeps multiple devices topped up simultaneously.

As if the wireless charging wasn’t enough, Magic Holder has a built-in plug for the U.S., China and Japan outlet, with prongs that fold neatly away. This thoughtful design frees you from carrying any cables and adapters, making it perfect for travelers.

Note: Magic Holder can also be recharged by plugging a cable to its USB Type-C input port.

 

Magic Holder is equipped with a camera lens detector for you to scan for hidden cameras by sweeping it around the room while you are in the room of a hotel, an Airbnb or a cruise line. A camera lens will sparkle or illuminate on the detector’s viewfinder indicating that a camera may be present.

 

Magic Holder incorporates a LED flashlight that is bright enough to illuminate a large area, ideal for outdoor use, emergency lighting and camping. You can also switch between green, blue and red light.

Protection circuitry incorporated in Magic Holder is essential to prevent over temperature, over voltage, under voltage, over current, over charge, over discharge and short circuit, providing you with unmatched peace of mind.

 

The ring holder on the back of Magic Holder provides extra grip and security for reduced risk of dropping as you are using it or carrying it throughout the day. Its 360° versatile rotating and swiveling abilities offer a customizable fit to your finger as well as propping up your phone and charging it while binge-watching.

 

The LED display indicates the remaining power percentage, output/input state and voltage. The low-profile ambient light and speaker on Magic Holder also prompt visual and vocal cues when performing charging and camera detection function.

story:
Don't you hate it when your smartphone runs out of battery?

We get it – There are only a few things more frustrating than watching your smartphone battery life drain away in the middle of the day when you left home with a full charge that very morning. It gets worse when you have had an unexpected delay, or haven't been able to fully charge your phone, and you need to make a few calls, send that important work email or use your GPS and maps function to find your way home.

Even with the longest smartphone battery life, there will come a time when you will need that extra boost of battery life to keep you connected.

Wouldn't it be Awesome if you didn't ever have to worry about your smartphone running out of battery?

Wouldn't it be nice not having to worry about lugging that annoying wall charger and usb cable around, or remembering to pack that chunky power bank with you everywhere you go?

Wouldn't it be nice not to have to stop at coffee shops or next to a power socket just to charge your phone?

Wouldn't it be nice to be able to get through an entire day without having to carry all that "equipment" around?

Meet KEYCHARGE

KEYCHARGE is a reserve battery keychain.

This little keychain is designed to give your smartphone extended battery life. Designed for smartphones and micro USB devices, it's 1000mAh battery is designed to give you 5.5 to 6 hours of extra talk time or up to a 24 hours more standby, depending on how you use your smartphone.

Best of all, KEYCHARGE'S compact keychain size and integrated charging connectors mean you'll always have backup power on you.

Design

KEYCHARGE comes in both your choice of lightning connector or micro USB, making it compatible with the majority of smartphones.

Lightning connector. Works with every iPhone, and iPod with a Lightning connector. This includes:

  • iPhone 5, iPhone 5C and iPhone 5S 
  • iPod touch and iPod nano (current generation) 

Micro USB. Works with every smartphone with a standard micro USB connector. This includes:

  • Samsung Galaxy S2, S3, S4, Galaxy Note 
  • HTC One Nokia Lumia, 920, 925 and 1020 
  • Sony Xperia 
  • Blackberry 
  • Amazon Kindle

Specifications:

  • Compatibility                               Smartphones & USB devices 
  • Battery Capacity                          1000mAh 
  • Flash Drive Storage                     NA/16GB/32GB 
  • Weight                                         28g 
  • Dimensions                                 70mm x 30mm x 10mm 
  • Flash Drive Compatibility            USB 2.0

Our Story

We first came up with the idea for KEYCHARGE when we couldn't find a backup charger for our smartphones that was compact, smart, simple, and elegant enough for everyday use. Everything that was on the market was too large to conveniently take with you everywhere.

We wanted to create something that you wouldn't have to worry about forgetting, a true back-up juice pack that you would always be able to have on you all the time. This was when we first started sketching a design for KEYCHARGE and also started looking for a suitable battery that was small enough to fit in a keychain unit and give smartphones true extended battery life. We tested 800-1200mAh batteries and finally decided on 1000mAh battery because it gave us the perfect balance of battery life and design flexibility for the keychain unit.

Through several iterations of sketch prototypes and testing with an experienced manufacturer we now have a production ready model that we are very happy with and ready to deliver to you.

Our Plan

We are now ready to bring you KEYCHARGE. After thorough testing and quality inspection of numerous prototypes. We now have our production-ready models ready. There are however a few key steps we need to take to deliver KEYCHARGE.

With your help, we need to: 

All we need is you

This is where we need your support. We think KEYCHARGE is an awesome product and we are super excited about it, but we need your help to turn it into a reality. We have lots of exciting discounts and special perks available to our Indiegogo backers, and we hope that together we can turn this product into a something special that you are going to love!

Perks

FAQ.

Q. How does it work?    

A. You charge the KEYCHARGE by plugging the USB connector it into your computer or wall charger. As and when you need, plug your KEYCHARGE using either a lightning connector/micro USB into your smartphone or USB device and begin charging. 

Q. How long does the battery last? 

A. The rechargeable battery lasts up to 20 days.

Q. How do I choose the connector type for my KEYCHARGE? 

A. At the end of the campaign, we will contact all contributors and you will be able to verify your connector preference

Q. Do I add the international shipping fee to the contribution amount or is it charged later? 

A. Please add the 10 USD shipping fee to your contribution total when you select a perk. 

Q. Can I use it to charge my phone from a laptop?    

A. Yes. You can Sync-and-Charge which means you will be able to sync your smartphone while charging it simultaneously.

Q. How many charge cycles do you get?    

A. The KEYCHARGE will be rechargeable for over 500 cycles (These are full cycles. Partial cycles don't count as full. So, you can charge your KEYCHARGE 10% of the way 10 times before it counts as a complete cycle.)

High resolution photos for PRESS download here. For press inquiries, please contact us at info@keycharge.co. Follow KEYCHARGE on Twitter @keycharge or visit us at www.keycharge.co.

story:
Lets take SOCIAL BACK! 

Got your attention?  Think about all the time you spend updating your social networks, entering status messages, photos and comments, friending, check-ins; you get the drift. You agree to their terms and conditions and guess what?!   They areno longer your photos, they are Facebook’s photos!   It is no longer your stream of updates, it is Twitte'rs!   And this is all for the purpose of showing you ads in return for your social content. 

This is YOUR content, not the social networks’ content.  This is an investment you make in time and effort updating your family, friends and business associates on what is going on in your life.  Due to the ease of use with these social networks, you are basically creating a living journal or diary of your life.  Remember GeoCities, SixDegrees, MSN Spaces, Friendster, MySpace or Google Orkut?   They all went out of business or closed down and millions of people lost their social content.  Well, it is time to take your content back! 

Take photos, for example; everyone is using their iPhones or Android phones to upload pictures to social networking sites because it’s so darn simple!  I know of some people who have over 1,000 photos uploaded into Facebook from pictures taken on their iPhone.  Crazy, but makes sense because it is so easy to do.   Well, how do you download those hundreds of photos to your computer?   That is not an easy task and it’s by design!

Photos are just one example; our goal is to bring your ENTIRE social network content back to you. Just think about pulling back all of the comments on your photos or all of your status messages. Even better, think about pulling back contact information on all of your friends and business associates! And even better, no sponsored ads in the application! That is just awesome! 

The Pitch

Well, for some reason, the social networking sites think they own your content.  NOPE.  Well, it is a part of the user agreement you clicked when you signed up for their service.  But, it is YOUR content and you need it back. socialsync is the tool that allows you to preserve and manage your social network life.  Just imagine having all the messages you post across all those social networking sites available as your own personal timeline.  That is cool!

 

As you can imagine, everything will be searchable so you can quickly find information you are looking for. Want to get to a specific photo? Click it and we’ll take you to the Pictures folder where that photo is stored on your computer. Google Picasa, or whichever photo software you use can now index all of those photos. All of your social content can easily be managed and maintained in socialsync on your computer. Beautiful!

 

Another great feature will be the ability to sync all your social friends and associate contact information right to your computer as vCards. What is a vCard you may ask? It is basically the business card for each of your contacts. If your friends included their contact information like phone, email and mailing address, that will be automatically pulled to your computer and available in your other software programs. Connected!

How will we do it? socialsync can manage all your social network accounts, connecting to those services, pulling your content and saving it to your Windows PC or MAC computers. Information is sync’d directly from those social networks onto your computer. You can setup syncing frequency for each service and socialsync will do it for you behind the scenes. Simple! You can even backup your content to cloud services like Dropbox, Microsoft Skydrive and Google Drive, and easily access it on your smartphone too!

Oh yeah, we will also have an iPhone and Android version available at a later date.

Cost 

socialsync will be a commercial piece of software available for the Windows and MAC operating systems. There will be two versions of the software, Facebook and All Social Editions. The Facebook edition is just for Facebook and the All Social edition includes all social networking platforms (linkedIn, Twitter, and Google+ for now). We are estimating a cost of $5.95 (USD) for the Facebook Edition and $10.95 for the All Social version. 

Funding Uses 

We have a working prototype for Windows that connects to Facebook and is already sync’ing content. This has been funded out-of-pocket and developed as time permits. When you develop part-time, you get part-time software. We want to make this the perfect piece of software found on your Windows or MAC computers. We thought it would be great to offer an opportunity to Indiegogo members to participate and help us finish out this much needed software.

  • Development: Funds will be used to add full-time developers to our team, in order to build out content syncs for other social networks like Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+ and Instagram. We’ll have a couple of developers focused on the Windows development and a few others focused on MAC development, as we believe we need to supply software for both operating systems.
  • Product Marketing: Funds will also be used for product marketing to get the word out in a BIG WAY, as we believe this is an important piece of software everyone should be utilizing in the social networking space.

How long will it take?

Since our prototype was first completed in Windows utilizing Facebook, our tentative plan is to release a beta 10 weeks after funding.   The MAC version should take 10 to 12 weeks.  Then, every 5 to 6 weeks, we will send out FREE updates that will include new social networking platforms and minor features.

Does more funding mean more stuff?

Absolutely! We  can hire a bigger and more diverse team so that we can add support for more languages and potentially even cooler things than we’ve discussed here.  We have a roadmap of ideas of making socialsync the center of your social networking universe.  So, if we get overfunded, we will be able to provide even more features quicker to our community of supporters.

Can I Participate?

You bet!  Our Indiegogo founders will be actively involved in the development and beta testing of our software.   Software is never designed and built just by developers; you need an active community to participate.  We figured if you have a vested interested, you will provide great feedback, too!  We look forward to working with you on socialsync.

All of your social content can easily be managed and maintained in socialsync on your computer. Beautiful!

 
Another great feature will be the ability to sync all your social friends and associate contact information right to your computer as vCards. What is a vCard you may ask? It is basically the business card for each of your contacts. If your friends included their contact information like phone, email and mailing address, that will be automatically pulled to your computer and available in your other software programs. Connected!

How will we do it? socialsync can manage all your social network accounts, connecting to those services, pulling your content and saving it to your Windows PC or MAC computers. Information is sync’d directly from those social networks onto your computer. You can setup syncing frequency for each service and socialsync will do it for you behind the scenes. Simple! You can even backup your content to cloud services like Dropbox, Microsoft Skydrive and Google Drive, and easily access it on your smartphone too!
Oh yeah, we will also have an iPhone and Android version available at a later date.

Cost 
socialsync will be a commercial piece of software available for the Windows and MAC operating systems. There will be two versions of the software, Facebook and All Social Editions. The Facebook edition is just for Facebook and the All Social edition includes all social networking platforms (linkedIn, Twitter, and Google+ for now). We are estimating a cost of $5.95 (USD) for the Facebook Edition and $10.95 for the All Social version. 
Funding Uses 
We have a working prototype for Windows that connects to Facebook and is already sync’ing content. This has been funded out-of-pocket and developed as time permits. When you develop part-time, you get part-time software. We want to make this the perfect piece of software found on your Windows or MAC computers. We thought it would be great to offer an opportunity to Indiegogo members to participate and help us finish out this much needed software.


Development: Funds will be used to add full-time developers to our team, in order to build out content syncs for other social networks like Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+ and Instagram. We’ll have a couple of developers focused on the Windows development and a few others focused on MAC development, as we believe we need to supply software for both operating systems.

Product Marketing: Funds will also be used for product marketing to get the word out in a BIG WAY, as we believe this is an important piece of software everyone should be utilizing in the social networking space.
How long will it take?
Since our prototype was first completed in Windows utilizing Facebook, our tentative plan is to release a beta 10 weeks after funding.   The MAC version should take 10 to 12 weeks.  Then, every 5 to 6 weeks, we will send out FREE updates that will include new social networking platforms and minor features.

Does more funding mean more stuff?
Absolutely! We  can hire a bigger and more diverse team so that we can add support for more languages and potentially even cooler things than we’ve discussed here.  We have a roadmap of ideas of making socialsync the center of your social networking universe.  So, if we get overfunded, we will be able to provide even more features quicker to our community of supporters.
Can I Participate?
You bet!  Our Indiegogo founders will be actively involved in the development and beta testing of our software.   Software is never designed and built just by developers; you need an active community to participate.  We figured if you have a vested interested, you will provide great feedback, too!  We look forward to working with you on socialsync.

story:
Update: miniSWARM to Wifi and Web Demo App

*Sorry for the shakey camera ^_^!

miniSWARM in the news:

The miniSWARM is...

A smart choice: The miniSWARM is a versatile USB stick-sized wireless Arduino development board. It’s as powerful as the Arduino Mega and has the wireless capabilities of an XBee radio, but we’ve made it a fraction of the cost of an Arduino + radio shield - cheap enough to leave in any project.

A wireless powerhouse: We’ve ported Atmel’s LightWeight Mesh library to Arduino, and made it dead simple to form and manage a network. We took the fuss out of communication diagnostics by integrating range testing features transparently into the library. On top of that, we are developing over-the-air programming (also built into the library) that allows the miniSWARM to be programmed wirelessly. You’ll never need to pop it out of your circuit for a software update!

For Arduino and more: Out of the box miniSWARM uses the Arduino platform for software development and programming and supports the standard libraries (digital i/o, analog, pwm, serial, I2C etc.). However, we’ve added an (optional) external antenna connector, ICSP and JTAG support for advanced users who want to work with a different IDE or use Atmel’s BitCloud ZigBee Pro API.

A complete package: miniSWARM doesn’t require any additional hardware or shields, not even a USB cable. Just plug the USB edge connector into your PC and upload your sketch. There is a standard LiPo battery connector and charger on-board for providing power to your miniSWARM and application circuit.

Open source: We proudly support the open-source hardware and software community. Once the campaign is complete all of the documentation, PCB design files and source code will be made available on our Wiki.

Technical Details

The miniSWARM uses Atmel's ATmega128RFA1 microcontroller which features a built-in 802.15.4 RF transceiver. The complete hardware and software specifications are here, or read the PDF spec sheet by clicking on the image below.

Projects to get you started...

These are some of the apps that will come with the miniSWARM Arduino library.

Want to learn more?

Visit the miniSWARM FAQ to learn more about the platform and what else it can do. Got a question? Post a comment!

We need your support!!!

$20,000 goal

We need your support to raise $20,000 for the first production run of the miniSWARM. Our goal is to make miniSWARM affordable enough to leave in your projects without burning a hole in your wallet. We've cleverly designed the board to be minimalistic (although loaded with features), but we can't bring down the cost to our target of $25 without manufacturing hundreds of them.

The funds will be used for:
  • PCB fabrication of the first batch
  • Electronic component stock
  • PCB assembly labour and testing
  • Firmware programming and functionality testing
  • Quality control
  • Packaging and shipping

$35,000 stretch goal SHIELD ADAPTER

We're not interested in re-inventing the wheel with miniSWARM-only shields. We plan on manufacturing a shield adapter for the miniSWARM so it can be mated with hundreds of standard Arduino shields. If we reach the stretch goal the shield will be available with the release of the miniSWARM in mid-June 2013! In the mean-time, the protoshield can be used.

Distribution

Once the first batch is manufactured and we ship out all the units to our backers, the miniSWARM will be available to distributors for resale.

Shipping

All but one of our perks come with free shipping to the US/Canada. International shipping is $5 for orders under $250, and $10 for oders above $250. Shipping periods are:

CANADA - 5 - 10 days

USA - 1.5 - 2 weeks

INTERNATIONAL - 2 to 4 weeks

If you want to insure and expedite your package, please add $10 on oders of $100 and under, and $15 for orders above $100 if your are in the US or Canada. For international orders please add $30.

miniSWARM + battery + case perk

This perk is the perfect project companion. It comes with a board, a 850mAh LiPo battery and a small enclosure to house the two. Small components will comfortably fit inside (LEDs, switches, sensors). For added fun send us a graphic and we'll print it on the case label.

Development Roadmap

Hardware

  • Functional prototype printed and tested - DONE!
  • Final miniSWAM design for volume manufacturing - DONE!
  • Manufacturer for PCB, assembly - ON STANDBY!
  • Component distributor - AWAITING ORDER
  • Testing jig for miniSWARM - IN PROGRESS
  • Production run order - mid May 2013
  • miniSWARM shield adapter prototype - mid May 2013 if funded
  • Production run testing & QA - early June 2013
  • Orders shipped - mid June 2013

Software

  • Beta testing of standard Arduino libraries - DONE!
  • LightWeight Mesh ported to Arduino - DONE!
  • USB bootloader and virtual serial driver - DONE!
  • Sample projects - DONE!
  • miniSWARM utility Beta - Beta DONE!
  • Range testing integration - DONE!
  • Over-the-air programming - IN PROGRESS
  • Final testing of standard Arduino libraries - mid April 2013
  • Final miniSWARM utility testing on Windows/Mac/Linux - early May 2013

Thank you, thank you!

Thank you for your support! We want to hear from you, so feel free to post in the comments section or e-mail us directly!

Please spread the word!

Like this campaign page!

Visit the miniSWARM Facebook page!

Follow us on TWITTER (@miniSWARM) for the latest updates!

story:
The Pain

Have you ever sat in your car waiting for your phone to charge?
Have you ever left your phone in the car to charge?
Have you ever grabbed a power bank* only to find it discharged?

If you answered YES to any of these questions, POCKET ROCKET is for you!


POCKET ROCKET is a patent pending, combined dual USB charger and power supply that plugs into your car's cigarette lighter socket.  POCKET ROCKET has an internal battery which allows you to continue charging or using your device even after it is removed from the car, as wells as a state-of-charge indicator and a small accessory light.  



Backstory

POCKET ROCKET was invented by mad scientist and meaningful inventor Michael Tyrannosaurus Kadie (also a one-time simultaneous holder of three world records.).  The idea was borne during a first date.  Michael's date's phone was drained of power, and his power bank* was completely empty, so they sat awkwardly in her car for 20 minutes while her phone charged. 



Experienced, Award Winning Team

Michael and his partners have worked with lithium ion batteries for nearly a decade, and have built multiple world record setting electric cars and portable power packs for cell tower field engineers.  They have developed an ultra low power battery management system for electric cars, as well as a wheel chair battery management system, and have partnered in the launch of an famous electric car manufacturer's (OEM) product launch.  This winning team has now focused their vital experience into the development of a consumer product.


POCKET ROCKET was honored as a winner at the New Consumer Products category at the Inventors Forum San Diego.

What we need, and what's in it for you!

We need funding to create injection molds in order to mass produce POCKET ROCKET.

You get the 5th iteration of our patent pending, award winning, charger with internal battery.  Win/Win!



Other Ways You Can Help

Help us increase awareness of POCKET ROCKET by telling your friends and sharing our campaign on social media.

story:
Who Are We...

Matt is a product development entrepreneur and designer living in the Chinese city of Ningbo.  I live in a city based on product creation and production, and every so often problems come past my desk and need solutions. Randy runs a manfacturing support company with a team of engineers and support staff to design and manufacture products. Together we found the need and solution for solving the Smart Case fit problem for the iPad 2.

The Story…

My friend Randy and I created a neat little insert that makes the iPad 2 fit inside apples newest accessory for the NEW iPad... the Smart Case.  Because the NEW iPad is 3/4's of a millimeter thicker than the iPad 2, the Smart Case fits sloppy and altogether loose.  Our insert takes up the missing space left when you are trying to use it on the iPad 2... simple as that!  We already made the die.. and have product waiting.  SO if you have an iPad 2 and want to use the Smart Case... this simple inexpensive product does the trick.  But don't take my word for it.... better yet.... watch the video and literally take my word for it.

The Product…

The product is a specially designed soft non-woven pad insert that fits in the back of the Smart Case.  When layed in, the pad precisely takes up the space lost from the larger NEW iPad.  So you essentially get a perfect fit on your iPad 2.  Actually, you gain a little cushion when you use the pad, and give you a little added layer of protection.

The Pitch…

So if you have an Ipad 2 and want to use the Smart Case, it’s a no brainer.  We have product waiting on hand… and ready to ship.  So order now, and we will send you out an insert right after the project ends!

Bloggers, want a sample to write about…

If you have an iPad 2, and the new Smart Case, have a way to get the information out to readers, we can send you a sample to review!  Just email us and give us your address.

Thanks for your interests, and please help by posting in your facebook, tweet about it or just tell your friends.  Thanks so much!

story:
Our Vision

Our vision is to bring free messaging, calls, location sharing or even broadcasting messages in places without mobile networks.




The Free Series is the first add-on accessory to truly supercharge your phone and enables people to communicate even if there isn’t mobile network available. Whether you are high up in the Andes or trekking through mountains in rural China, the Free Series will allow you to communicate with your friends through voice, text and even share your current location.

Thanks to its dedicated app, the Free Series utilizes your phones built in GPS locator, allowing you to plot a map of all your locations in a timeline powered by OpenStreetMaps. Once your phone gets back on to an internet connection, your messages and timeline will be safely backed up to the cloud. 

Use Cases

  • Whether you are camping, jogging or biking. The Free Series can help you stay connected with your friends while allowing you to enjoy the scenic environment around you.



  • Even though you might be travelling a country without cost friendly data plan options, you can still keep in touch and share your location with the Free Series. Whether you're on a crowded street, flea market or at local festival, you'll be able to stay in touch with the people around you.


  • Whether you are lost in a megamall when travelling or even on a cruise with no reception,  You will now be able to reach your friends or family members locally without an additional phone plan.

      



Our Products


                                                 

                                   FreeButton

With the FreeButton, you get the ultimate off-grid portable communicator. In just a tiny form factor you get amazing connectivity features, alongside GPS tracking through our VocalText app. You will also be able to plot and share your location through OpenStreetMaps.


                                 FreePower


With the FreePower, you get a large capacity battery alongside all the features that you get with the rest of the Free Series. This means the FreePower will last for an extremely long period of time, allowing you to share your location, talk and message your friends to your heart’s content. The FreePower also acts as an portable powerbank for your smartphone. So if your phone is running low on juice, just plug in your FreePower and you’ll be good to go. 







Q & A

1. What is VocalText? FreeButton? and FreePower?

​Vocaltext is a workgroup that was formed by engineers who devoted their time and effort to change how people communicate to each other in off-grid areas or people who want to reach their one or many friends instantly through voice or text.  We also want to make broadcasting and one on one communication easily accessible for people anywhere within range. We named our core technology Vocaltext and the two devices we are offering are the FreeButton and the FreePower; radio receivers and transmitters that communicate with text or calls through a smartphone app.

The FreeButton is a small form factor communications device. With a bluetooth connection you would be able to call, text and even share your location off grid. 

For adventurers who want an portable battery charger alongside all the communications features of the FreeButton, we have the FreePower, an off grid communications device with a built in battery pack  for ultra long battery life and the ability to top off your mobile devices on the go. 


2. Why do I need it? What are the applications?

​The FreeButton and FreePower are for people who frequently travel to areas with low or no cell connection or people who want want an instant and cost free way to reach their friends through text or calls. With the Free Series, you will be able to communicate with other Free Series devices even if you are off the grid with no cell towers for miles around. The Free Series also allow people to broadcast their conversations, or engage their friends and family in an one to one chat.

​

3. What’s the working principle?

​The Free Series uses a radio connection to pass text and calls through our dedicated smartphone app. The connection for communicating between the devices are done independently of your phone’s antennas. With the Free Series, it utilizes an inbuilt mic and speaker, so it can communicate independently without a phone. This mean you would be able to stay connected when you are off the gird.

​

​

4. How much does it cost to use a Free Series device?

​The Free Series utilizes the built in radio transmitter and receiver in the devices, so none of the communication protocols are done with outside parties. This means free text and calls in most areas you go.

However if you decide to backup your texts or locations to the internet, your internet provider may decide to charge you for roaming or any other fees they might have.

​

5. How far is the working range?

​The working range for the FreeButton and FreePower is around 3 km.

​

6. Can it work without a smartphone?

​The Free Series with the inbuilt mic and speaker can be operated independently of a smartphone, but for the text messaging and GPS location, it is going to need a Bluetooth connection with a smartphone in order to its full potential.

​

7. What is the cloud storage for?

​The cloud storage can be used to store text and your timeline locations. This means you’ll be able to access your information regardless if you switch devices! 

​

8. Is the cloud storage free of charge?

​Our cloud storage system will be free for the first year. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help by getting the word out in your Facebook and Twitter
  • Mention our campaign on your Blog.
  • Or simply use the Indiegogo share tools!

The FreeButton and FreePower is now available on Indiegogo for preorders. Support us now and be part of the next mobile revolution.

​The Free Series with the inbuilt mic and speaker can be operated independently of a smartphone, but for the text messaging and GPS location, it is going to need a Bluetooth connection with a smartphone in order to its full potential.
​
7. What is the cloud storage for?
​The cloud storage can be used to store text and your timeline locations. This means you’ll be able to access your information regardless if you switch devices! 
​
8. Is the cloud storage free of charge?
​Our cloud storage system will be free for the first year. 

    Other Ways You Can Help Even you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  You can help by getting the word out in your Facebook and Twitter
Mention our campaign on your Blog. Or simply use the Indiegogo share tools!   The FreeButton and FreePower is now available on Indiegogo for preorders. Support us now and be part of the next mobile revolution.

story:
Intro

GeniusHold is the idea of a Swedish entrepreneur.  Constantly fumbling with tangled earbud wires when phone calls came in, he figured there had to be a better way to keep earbuds handy – and in order – when he needed to use them.  And if he was using wireless earpods, he still wanted them at the ready.  He didn’t want them always in his ears, in a pocket or lost somewhere in the center console of his car where he had to dig or search for them.  The same held true for his wife – she didn’t want to search through the bottom of her purse to find her earpods.  Thus, the idea of a simple holder that could fasten to your shirt, blouse or pocket to keep your earbuds at the ready was born!  Hello GeniusHold.

 

Product

Made of a durable, yet flexible and sturdy plastic composite, the GeniusHold has a rounded all-angle clip on the back.  It easily slides onto a shirt, blouse or pocket and has just enough pinch to hold the GeniusHold in place.  The front has two compartments to cradle each earbud separately with an open slot in front to accommodate wires if needed.  The opening of the cradle and the front groove at the top of the GeniusHold are angled and wider in order to accommodate earbuds that may need to rest facing out due to varying earbud size adapters.  The GeniusHold prototype can accommodate up to 95% of all earbuds on the market today.

 

GeniusHold Details

  • Eliminates the “tangled wires” earbud problem
  • Keeps earbuds at the ready for phone calls, music, podcasts and more
  • Eliminates the need to have earbuds sitting in your ears all the time (ugh!)
  • Keeps wireless earbuds out of chargers, increasing battery life
  • Accommodates up to 95% of all earbuds on the market
  • The back clip can be printed with a logo, copy, etc. to be used as a promotional item
  • Made in the good ol’ USA

 

What We Want To Do

We are looking to raise $30,000 for product molding, fabrication and packaging.  It’s that simple.  If we don’t reach our entire goal, we’ll still move forward with production but on a smaller scale.  This is a simple product without a lot of moving parts.  It’s extremely scalable once the initial molds are made.

The GeniusHold isn’t going to change the world, but sometimes all we need is just a smart product that can make life a little easier – one that addresses a need and fulfills it – like GeniusHold.

 

Risks

Risks are minimal as the product is fairly simple.  Fine tuning the product and ensuring that the final molds are correct and to precise specifications is of utmost importance.  Once initial samples are produced and tested – and pass – then we’re good-to-go.  It’s a matter of attention to detail and quality control.  We’ve got this!

 

Summary

We don’t have multiple videos for you to watch or endless photos to gaze at.  The GeniusHold is one of those concepts that is simple and easy to understand.  Watch the animation or the quick video, look at a couple of pictures and you get it.  Now help us get it made.

 

Help Us!

Supporting us financially with a pledge would be awesome.  But we’d love for you to help spread the word too.  Use the Indiegogo share tools and visit our website at www.GeniusHold.com

Give us a follow on Instagram and Facebook

 

And Thank You Too!

  • Special thanks to Jack Jägerman at MAZE VFX for producing our GeniusHold animation.
  • Special thanks to Michael Carlos for his design work on the GeniusHold.

story:
Expand M is a new multifunctional GADGETS designed by Beelink. It integrates the functions of SSD mobile hard drives and four-in-one expansion docks. It is compact and easy to carry. It can meet the needs of the daily port expansion and additional fast storage needs and supports a variety of platform equipment.

 

You can also find Expand M in the official Beelink store.

 

Main feature

  • Screen mirroring projection
  • 4 in 1 port integration
  • Expansion peripheral connection
  • Support 4K output
  • Switch SSD working status with one key
  • M.2 SSD mobile storage
  • Full metal body
  • Scalable computers, laptops, tablets, mobile phones

 

Why launch Expand M

In recent years, computers have begun to pursue thin and light, such as Apple Macbook and Lenovo ultra-thin notebooks, the whole machine only has type-c interface and headphone port. Although these reforms are all about reducing the burden on technology products and improving battery life, they are for office workers. 

For people who travel frequently, there is no USB interface, U disk, keyboard, and mouse, no HDMI interface, it is inconvenient for small screens to cast large screens, and the reduction of body interfaces sometimes brings inconvenience to work.

In order to increase the port of the notebook, it is necessary to expand the dock. The docking station can add more interface options to the notebook computer. The docking station has USB ports, HDMI ports, etc., so if the ports are not enough, a docking station can be equipped to solve this problem.

However, more and more peripheral products are occupying our space, and we need to carry more products to get a good experience. This completely violates the concept of pursuing lightness and space-saving. We hope to combine the functions of multiple products. This is reflected in a product, so we launched Expand M.

 

Expand M function


First of all, Expand M is a USB-C 4-IN-1 Docking Station


Expand M has HDMI HD video port*1, which can support 4K output, so you can connect any device with USB-C (support DP alt mode) to a monitor or TV with HDMI port through Expand M, including mobile phones and tablets Computers and laptops can expand a large screen, allowing you to watch on a larger screen.

 

Expand M has two USB-A 3.0. In our actual test, the average speed can reach 107M/S. Whether you use USB-A to connect an external hard drive to transfer files or connect peripherals, you can get a good speed, and there is no latency.

 

Expand M has a USB-C input port, supports PD fast charge protocol, and can be connected to a power adapter of up to 100w to directly supply power to connected devices.

 

Expand M extended USB-C cable is a USB-C output port, supports DP ALT MODE function can output video and audio signals, supports 100W PD fast charge protocol, can also be used as an output transmission port, the highest speed can reach 440M/ S.


High-speed  SSD mobile storage

Expand M has a built-in M.2 2280 SSD slot and adopts the third-generation SATA transmission protocol. Measured SSD data transmission speed can reach 440M/S, and it can support up to 4TB expansion.

 

Expand M exploded view

Expand M uses an all-metal material, which further provides high drop resistance, corrosion resistance, and strong heat dissipation characteristics, which can effectively extend the service life.

 

The customized USB-C extension cable uses the FPC cable, and the metal wire is wrapped by rubber. It is soft and bendable and can be folded at will without damaging the cable.

 

The read and write the life of SSD is determined by the constitution of the storage particles, but the service life of the best storage particles is fixed. Expand M can switch the operating state of the SSD through the specially designed "M" key. When the green light is on When the SSD is in working condition, when the blue light is on, the SSD will stop reading and writing to extend the service life of the SSD. If you connect a mobile device such as a laptop, it can also reduce power consumption Extend the use time of mobile devices.

Each configuration of Expand M has three colors to choose from, professional and calm Dark blue, mysterious and calm Space gray, you can choose the color you like.

The size of Expand M is 115.3mm*39.3mm*11mm, the length of the USB-C extension cable is 121.4mm, After being folded, the length is less than 12cm, and it can be carried with you in your pocket.

 

Specs sheet


Please note that your mobile phone or other device needs to have a Type-C interface, and the Type-C interface needs to support the DP Alt mode to use the Expand M screen expansion function.

 

Where do we ship to?


We provide free shipping worldwide! However, the listed prices do not include value-added tax and goods and services tax, depending on the country of delivery. The supporter is responsible for paying these fees (value-added tax, goods and service tax, customs duties, taxes, etc.).

Indian orders: Due to the outbreak of the pandemic, orders for shipments to India have been postponed.
Brazil order: Please provide your personal tax number to Beelink.
Russian/Romanian orders: The recipient must be a company with customs clearance capabilities.
Argentine orders: Please consult the local organization before setting up the process before placing the order.

 

Delivery and after-sales


We support our products and services with confidence. We provide a one-year warranty for Expand M. If your product has any quality problems during normal use during the warranty period, you can request warranty service by sending an email to support-pc@bee-link.com. We will provide after-sales support in accordance with the after-sales policy. 

Please understand that we only accept returns for quality reasons. Any unexcused or unannounced return will be rejected.
All products must be returned in the original box (as far as possible) and all accessories in good condition.
If you receive a damaged or defective product, please contact the Beelink team via email within 30 days of delivery: support-pc@bee-link.com.
When contacting us, please provide your order number.
We provide a free service of global delivery, you can select the memory specification on the checkout page. 

 

Brand introduction

The Introduction Beelink
Beelink was established in Shenzhen, China in 2011. Beelink focuses on the definition, research and development, production, and sales of home entertainment equipment and productivity tools. TV BOX and MINI PC products have been loved by users for a long time.

This is the third time Beelink has conducted crowdfunding on Indiegogo. With the previous two crowdfunding experience, we have a more complete system for order delivery and after-sales processing, so that your order can be better processed.

This code is like phone number which the user must enter before the software start working.
Besides, this software after its development it will help make communication very easy for people of all classes without restrictions on any types.

story:
Meet Tablo.

Tablo is a next-generation DVR that plugs into an HDTV antenna to capture free, local HDTV broadcast programs including news and sports within the US and Canada. Unlike traditional DVRs that are connected to one TV, Tablo streams content to any connected device inside your home or anywhere you have internet.

Unleash your HDTV.

Browse, record and stream free local HDTV broadcast programs on any device, anytime, anywhere in the world. And it’s all yours without the expense or commitment of a cable or satellite contract.

Tablet User Interface

One touch of the Tablo interface and you’ll never settle for a traditional remote control again. It’s visually rich and colorful, intuitively organized and easy to use.

Tablo in the News


"Tablo is...as cheap and convenient as internet-only video while delivering the wider content selection of traditional TV."


"Video: A first look at Tablo, a DVR for cord cutters."




"Tablo is the latest entrant in the budding over-the-air DVR space."


"Tablo. A device that allows free, Over the Air (OTA) high definition TV content without the cable bill agony."


 

"Tablo and Simple.tv debut two new DVRs for cord cutters"


"Turning the Tablo on TV broadcasters: Canadian company looks to change how we watch TV"



"Pair Tablo with other streaming apps and cutting that pesky cable cord just got easier."



"So if Aereo turns out to be illegal, there'll be Nuvyyo."


"It’s a smart idea because that free content is there to be taken advantage of."


"Tapping into the power of the Android crowd"


"Ottawa's Nuvyyo Unveils Tablo, Which Aims to Make Cord-cutting Easier Than Ever"


"Tablo DVR, un enregistreur personnel pour la télévision OTA"


"Nuvyyo wants its Tablo DVR to be the Slingbox for over-the-air HD channels"


"Tablo is a high-tech “back end” DVR that connects your conventional TV antenna to essentially make a whole home DVR."



"I can see (Tablo) as being my missing link for a perfect TV viewing experience."


"Tablo : jumelez un ENP à votre tablette et profitez du HD gratuit."


"Check out Tablo…according to Engadget, it works really, really well."


“We are transforming today’s home media experience by delivering a better way to enjoy network and local programming in gorgeous HD, anywhere you happen to be. For TV lovers, Tablo takes away the fear of “cord-cutting” by perfecting the user experience with our tablet app and delivering the DVR functionality everyone knows and loves.” 
– Grant Hall, CEO of Nuvyyo

Start enjoying your HDTV. 
Stop paying for Cable.  

With the average cable or satellite TV bill hovering around $85 per month, savvy consumers can save over $2,000 over two years by cutting the cord.  

Major networks are all broadcasting their full programming content for free, in high definition over the air. This means that virtually everyone in North America has access to amazingly crisp TV shows simply by plugging in an HDTV antenna.

Better Quality HD Video that won't tie up your bandwidth.

Cable operators compress their TV signals to conserve bandwidth in order to deliver multiple services (phone, TV and internet) over a single connection. Over-the-Air (OTA) HDTV signals received through antennae are uncompressed, delivering an incredibly crisp HD picture far superior to what you’ve been getting from your cable provider.

Watch your favorite shows, news and sports, live as they happen.  

For the avid sports or TV series fan, the day after airing is too long to wait to see the latest game or episode of their favorite show. Nobody likes having to avoid spoilers at the watercooler following the big game or season finale.

Tablo gives cord cutters access to first run broadcast TV in gorgeous High Definition and lets you record, stream and watch it commercial free, for less than the price of Netflix and other Over-The-Top and Internet content providers.

How does Tablo work?

The Tablo DVR box collects free Over-The-Air (OTA) broadcast content through a connected HDTV antenna.

Hardware set up is super easy:

  • Plug in your HDTV antenna
  • Plug in your USB Hard Drive
  • Plug in the power
  • Connect to your home's wireless router (using an Ethernet cable or WiFi)

Using the Tablo App is even easier:

  • Download and launch the Tablo app on your tablet
  • Follow the easy setup wizard

Tablo will scan for all HDTV channels available in your area and download guide data for all programs for the next two weeks.

OTA and OTT: Working together.

Tablo is designed to work alongside Over-The-Top (OTT) or internet content providers you may already be using, like Hulu and Netflix. 

Tablo lets you combine their great content with free, live HDTV broadcast programs like hometown news and sports, as well as community and public TV shows, eliminating the need for expensive cable/satellite TV subscriptions and contracts. 

We’re Canadian, eh!

Tablo works with OTA broadcast HDTV in both the US AND in Canada. So, while other solutions on the market are only available in the US, those of us North of the 49th parallel can cut the cord and watch our HDTV, our way, too!

Your HDTV, on your time.  

Tablo puts the control in your hands and at your fingertips to watch your HDTV your way, commercial free.

No Commitments. No strings. Just Your HDTV. Your way.

We wouldn’t help you cut the cord, only to tie you up with contracts. That’s just mean. With Tablo there’s no contract or commitment: cancel your subscription anytime with no penalty. 

What’s this about a subscription?

By becoming a supporter here on Indiegogo, you will get a one year Interactive Program Guide (IPG) subscription included with your Tablo for FREE. This gives you access to all the beautiful program guide content, including poster art, series and episode details, series recording capabilities, etc. 

While the Tablo DVR works without a subscription, we know you’ll fall in love with the convenience of the program guide data and beauty of the intuitive interface for setting up and managing your recordings.

After the first year, you can choose to subscribe to Tablo's interactive guide content for a fraction of any other mainstream DVR rental contract or subscription out there.

Hardware Development: 
Where we’re at…



As a start-up company, the process of selecting the right partners is key to a successful product. Thankfully, we already knew the right doors to knock on. 

This is not our first consumer electronics product and we’re using that experience to ensure a solid hardware platform for the Tablo DVR. 

The mechanical and industrial design company that we contracted has designed multiple consumer products. After explaining to them what we envisioned, they were able to provide initial models that were the right size and the right look and feel.

What we have now is a beautiful product that works great and is ready for manufacturing which will be handled by the same local contract manufacturer we hired to build our initial product a couple of years ago.

We’re excited to work with them again as they help propel us to high volume production.

Next Steps in Tablo Production:

We have DVR hardware prototypes in alpha testing and our software apps are coming along nicely. 

By choosing to support us, you will help us deliver a quality product faster, and at greater volume, which will keep our prices low and our feature list long.

Think we can do better? So do we.

We are in the development stages and are about to make some critical decisions on product roadmap and what features to prioritize in order to make Tablo what you want it to be. 

Do you live in a major urban center in the US or Canada? If so, we want to hear from you. We’re looking for a select number of people from different US and Canadian cities to join our beta team through our Beta Team perk.

Tablo is a Broadcast DVR and app built by TV lovers,
for TV lovers. 

We founded Nuvyyo in 2010 with a vision of mobilizing home media. We’re really proud of how far we’ve come and can’t wait to start using it our own homes.

We’re on Indiegogo because we want your support. But more importantly, we want your input. 

So tell us what would make Tablo even more awesome for you.

Better yet, put your money where your mouse is and become a supporter to have your say.

Be a part of something awesome, become a backer today and help us build a better way to watch free TV, your way with Tablo.

Thank you, from the entire team at Nuvyyo!


FAQs




Does Tablo connect to my TV?
No, Tablo streams live TV and recordings over your home network through Apple TV (and AirPlay), Roku (as a channel) or Chromecast (streaming via dongle to HDMI port) which connects to your TV. 

What do I need to use Tablo?
To use Tablo you need the following things:

  • an HDTV antenna
  • an Apple or Android tablet computer
  • an internet connection
  • a USB hard drive (for editions without onboard storage)

If you’d like to watch programming on your big screen TV, you’ll also need an AppleTV, Roku box or Chromecast dongle*.

* Support for Chromecast will become available after the full Chromecast API has been released by Google. 

What technologies does it work with? What devices can I use to watch programs?
Tablo enables you to browse, record and stream live HDTV programming on the following devices:

  • Apple and Android tablets
  • Apple and Android smartphones
  • PC or Mac computers
  • Televisions using enabling devices including AppleTV, Roku or Google Chromecast

How many tuners does Tablo have?
Tablo has two editions: one with two tuners which enables you to record two programs simultaneously or have two users in the household watching two different programs and one with four tuners which enables you to record four programs simultaneously. The Tablo app also supports the use of multiple Tablo boxes so if you need additional tuners you can always add another Tablo box.

How many shows can I record at once?
Tablo enables you to record two to four programs simultaneously, depending on the edition. 

How many people can watch Tablo at once?
This depends on the quality of your home WiFi network.  If Tablo has a wired connection to your home router and uses 802.1 G or N technology, up to 6 devices can watch a live or recorded program simultaneously. If the Tablo uses WiFi to connect to your home router, the number of simultaneous views could be cut in half.  

After the first year, if I don’t want to pay for the subscription can I still use my Tablo?  
Yes, your Tablo features a manual recording option that lets you schedule programs by channel, date and time.

Does Tablo have WiFi?
Yes, Tablo can connect to your home network via WiFi or Ethernet allowing you to place the Tablo box where it makes the most sense in your home. Some choose to place the Tablo box near their router, some near their antennas and others right in their TV stands. 

How will I know if I can get good HDTV reception where I live?
In general, those in major urban centers in Canada and the United States can be guaranteed to receive several free HDTV channels including most major networks. To find out exactly which channels you could receive at your house, visit www.tvfool.com for Canada or transition.fcc.gov/mb/engineering/dtvmaps/ for the US.

The quality of your HDTV reception is based on proximity to HDTV broadcast towers, the type of antenna you’re using and its location (indoor, outdoor, height off the ground, direction). 

If you’re receiving less channels than you think you should be, try adjusting the location or direction of your antenna. 

What sort of channels can I get with Tablo?
In the United States, customers in most areas will be able to get FOX, NBC, CBS, ABC, PBS, and CW networks. In Canada, most will be able to get CBC, CTV, Global, CityTV as well as regional and language-specific content. Canadians living close to the border may also be able to obtain signals from American networks. 

How much does it cost and how does that compare to other options?
Once it's available to the public, Tablo’s cost will be comparable to other Over-The-Air (OTA) HDTV DVRs with external storage. Estimated street pricing will be in the range of $200 for the 2 Tuner edition and $250 for the 4 tuner edition. DVRs with internal storage will cost more due to the additional components required.

To obtain program guide data, an additional fee of approximately $5-6 per month will be required (which is about half the cost of Netflix). Final pricing will depend several factors including the success of this campaign and market cost for the data itself. When compared to the average cost of a cable TV subscription (approximately $85 per month), consumers can expect to save around $2,000 over two years with Tablo.

Competitors offering OTA HDTV with no hardware via broadband are less expensive but are only available in a few select markets in the US. 

Any plans to support DLNA receivers? eg. I have a PS3, will that work?
We are looking at future support for  DLNA to be able to redirect video to devices like the Xbox 360 and Smart TV’s, but unfortunately the PS3 lacks the DLNA Digital Media Render function that would allow us to forward Video to the PS3.

Are there any plans to include an HDMI port for Tablo?
With prices of HDMI media adapters like Roku, Chromecast and Apple TV continuing to decline we believe they are a better option to deliver the video  the final few inches to your TV. One of the benefits of delivering video over your home network is that we can support multiple TVs, tablets or smartphones at the same time from a single Tablo.  This provides customers with a whole home DVR solution at a very compelling price point. For more information, check out our blog post on this subject: http://bit.ly/1bXVtV6

In what format does Tablo save the video/audio stream to the hard drive? Recorded programs on Tablo are stored in an HLS file that can be reassembled into a standard MPEG file.

How much storage space will a typical 60 minute HD recording use?
A 60 minute program will take approximately 2 Gigs of storage space.

Will Tablo support NAS (Network Attached Storage) drives or does it only support USB connected drives?
Tablo currently only supports USB 2.0 hard drives of up to 2 terabytes. One of the reasons why we aren’t currently supporting NAS storage is the wide variation in network speeds. That being said, this feature is on our roadmap.

Can I access the recordings over my network through the file browser/finder?Tablo files are not currently accessible over the local network.

What is Tablo’s video quality like?
Most broadcasters distribute signals at 720p or 1080i. Tablo enables you to select the video quality you want to record in. You can record/playback at the same quality coming out of your antenna, or choose to save storage space and record at lower quality.

When will Android support become available?
Our Android app is just a handful of weeks behind development of our iPad app so we plan to have Android support out of the gate. The Android native app will have the same functionality and look-and-feel as our iPad version.

Does Tablo support cable cards or clear QAM signals?
Tablo is focused on providing a DVR to capture High Definition Over-The-Air broadcast signals so we’re not currently considering adding support for cablecards or clear QAM.

Does Tablo enable you to pause live TV?
Yes, you can pause live and recorded TV with Tablo.

Can you skip commercials with Tablo?
Yes, Tablo offers 30 second skip capabilities as well as a 20 second rewind.


Have a question about Tablo? Leave us a comment and we'll get back to you right away.
story_txt:
Meet Tablo.
Tablo is a next-generation DVR that plugs into an HDTV antenna to capture free, local HDTV broadcast programs including news and sports within the US and Canada. Unlike traditional DVRs that are connected to one TV, Tablo streams content to any connected device inside your home or anywhere you have internet.


Unleash your HDTV.
Browse, record and stream free local HDTV broadcast programs on any device, anytime, anywhere in the world. And it’s all yours without the expense or commitment of a cable or satellite contract.



Tablet User Interface
One touch of the Tablo interface and you’ll never settle for a traditional remote control again. It’s visually rich and colorful, intuitively organized and easy to use.




Tablo in the News






"Tablo is...as cheap and convenient as internet-only video while delivering the wider content selection of traditional TV."




"Video: A first look at Tablo, a DVR for cord cutters."



"Tablo is the latest entrant in the budding over-the-air DVR space."





"Tablo.  A device that allows free, Over the Air (OTA) high definition TV content without the cable bill agony."

 
"Tablo and Simple.tv debut two new DVRs for cord cutters"



"Turning the Tablo on TV broadcasters: Canadian company looks to change how we watch TV"


"Pair Tablo with other streaming apps and cutting that pesky cable cord just got easier.""So if Aereo turns out to be illegal, there'll be Nuvyyo.""It’s a smart idea because that free content is there to be taken advantage of.""Tapping into the power of the Android crowd""Ottawa's Nuvyyo Unveils Tablo, Which Aims to Make Cord-cutting Easier Than Ever""Tablo DVR, un enregistreur personnel pour la télévision OTA""Nuvyyo wants its Tablo DVR to be the Slingbox for over-the-air HD channels""Tablo is a high-tech “back end” DVR that connects your conventional TV antenna to essentially make a whole home DVR.""I can see (Tablo) as being my missing link for a perfect TV viewing experience.""Tablo : jumelez un ENP à votre tablette et profitez du HD gratuit.""Check out Tablo…according to Engadget, it works really, really well."
“We are transforming today’s home media experience by delivering a better way to enjoy network and local programming in gorgeous HD, anywhere you happen to be. For TV lovers, Tablo takes away the fear of “cord-cutting” by perfecting the user experience with our tablet app and delivering the DVR functionality everyone knows and loves.” 
– Grant Hall, CEO of NuvyyoStart enjoying your HDTV. Stop paying for Cable.  With the average cable or satellite TV bill hovering around $85 per month, savvy consumers can save over $2,000 over two years by cutting the cord.  Major networks are all broadcasting their full programming content for free, in high definition over the air. This means that virtually everyone in North America has access to amazingly crisp TV shows simply by plugging in an HDTV antenna.Better Quality HD Video that won't tie up your bandwidth.Cable operators compress their TV signals to conserve bandwidth in order to deliver multiple services (phone, TV and internet) over a single connection. Over-the-Air (OTA) HDTV signals received through antennae are uncompressed, delivering an incredibly crisp HD picture far superior to what you’ve been getting from your cable provider.Watch your favorite shows, news and sports, live as they happen.  For the avid sports or TV series fan, the day after airing is too long to wait to see the latest game or episode of their favorite show. Nobody likes having to avoid spoilers at the watercooler following the big game or season finale.Tablo gives cord cutters access to first run broadcast TV in gorgeous High Definition and lets you record, stream and watch it commercial free, for less than the price of Netflix and other Over-The-Top and Internet content providers.
How does Tablo work?The Tablo DVR box collects free Over-The-Air (OTA) broadcast content through a connected HDTV antenna.Hardware set up is super easy:
Plug in your HDTV antenna
Plug in your USB Hard Drive
Plug in the power
Connect to your home's wireless router (using an Ethernet cable or WiFi)

Using the Tablo App is even easier:
Download and launch the Tablo app on your tablet
Follow the easy setup wizard
Tablo will scan for all HDTV channels available in your area and download guide data for all programs for the next two weeks.OTA and OTT: Working together.Tablo is designed to work alongside Over-The-Top (OTT) or internet content providers you may already be using, like Hulu and Netflix. Tablo lets you combine their great content with free, live HDTV broadcast programs like hometown news and sports, as well as community and public TV shows, eliminating the need for expensive cable/satellite TV subscriptions and contracts. We’re Canadian, eh!Tablo works with OTA broadcast HDTV in both the US AND in Canada. So, while other solutions on the market are only available in the US, those of us North of the 49th parallel can cut the cord and watch our HDTV, our way, too!Your HDTV, on your time.  Tablo puts the control in your hands and at your fingertips to watch your HDTV your way, commercial free.No Commitments. No strings. Just Your HDTV. Your way.We wouldn’t help you cut the cord, only to tie you up with contracts. That’s just mean. With Tablo there’s no contract or commitment: cancel your subscription anytime with no penalty. What’s this about a subscription?By becoming a supporter here on Indiegogo, you will get a one year Interactive Program Guide (IPG) subscription included with your Tablo for FREE. This gives you access to all the beautiful program guide content, including poster art, series and episode details, series recording capabilities, etc. While the Tablo DVR works without a subscription, we know you’ll fall in love with the convenience of the program guide data and beauty of the intuitive interface for setting up and managing your recordings.After the first year, you can choose to subscribe to Tablo's interactive guide content for a fraction of any other mainstream DVR rental contract or subscription out there.Hardware Development: Where we’re at…


As a start-up company, the process of selecting the right partners is key to a successful product. Thankfully, we already knew the right doors to knock on. 
This is not our first consumer electronics product and we’re using that experience to ensure a solid hardware platform for the Tablo DVR. The mechanical and industrial design company that we contracted has designed multiple consumer products. After explaining to them what we envisioned, they were able to provide initial models that were the right size and the right look and feel.What we have now is a beautiful product that works great and is ready for manufacturing which will be handled by the same local contract manufacturer we hired to build our initial product a couple of years ago.We’re excited to work with them again as they help propel us to high volume production.Next Steps in Tablo Production:We have DVR hardware prototypes in alpha testing and our software apps are coming along nicely. By choosing to support us, you will help us deliver a quality product faster, and at greater volume, which will keep our prices low and our feature list long.Think we can do better? So do we.We are in the development stages and are about to make some critical decisions on product roadmap and what features to prioritize in order to make Tablo what you want it to be. Do you live in a major urban center in the US or Canada? If so, we want to hear from you. We’re looking for a select number of people from different US and Canadian cities to join our beta team through our Beta Team perk.Tablo is a Broadcast DVR and app built by TV lovers, for TV lovers. We founded Nuvyyo in 2010 with a vision of mobilizing home media. We’re really proud of how far we’ve come and can’t wait to start using it our own homes.We’re on Indiegogo because we want your support. But more importantly, we want your input. So tell us what would make Tablo even more awesome for you.Better yet, put your money where your mouse is and become a supporter to have your say.Be a part of something awesome, become a backer today and help us build a better way to watch free TV, your way with Tablo.Thank you, from the entire team at Nuvyyo!FAQsDoes Tablo connect to my TV?No, Tablo streams live TV and recordings over your home network through Apple TV (and AirPlay), Roku (as a channel) or Chromecast (streaming via dongle to HDMI port) which connects to your TV. What do I need to use Tablo?To use Tablo you need the following things:

an HDTV antenna


an Apple or Android tablet computer


an internet connection


a USB hard drive (for editions without onboard storage)

If you’d like to watch programming on your big screen TV, you’ll also need an AppleTV, Roku box or Chromecast dongle*.* Support for Chromecast will become available after the full Chromecast API has been released by Google. What technologies does it work with? What devices can I use to watch programs?Tablo enables you to browse, record and stream live HDTV programming on the following devices:

Apple and Android tablets


Apple and Android smartphones


PC or Mac computers


Televisions using enabling devices including AppleTV, Roku or Google Chromecast

How many tuners does Tablo have?Tablo has two editions: one with two tuners which enables you to record two programs simultaneously or have two users in the household watching two different programs and one with four tuners which enables you to record four programs simultaneously. The Tablo app also supports the use of multiple Tablo boxes so if you need additional tuners you can always add another Tablo box.How many shows can I record at once?Tablo enables you to record two to four programs simultaneously, depending on the edition. How many people can watch Tablo at once?This depends on the quality of your home WiFi network.  If Tablo has a wired connection to your home router and uses 802.1 G or N technology, up to 6 devices can watch a live or recorded program simultaneously. If the Tablo uses WiFi to connect to your home router, the number of simultaneous views could be cut in half.  After the first year, if I don’t want to pay for the subscription can I still use my Tablo?  Yes, your Tablo features a manual recording option that lets you schedule programs by channel, date and time.Does Tablo have WiFi?Yes, Tablo can connect to your home network via WiFi or Ethernet allowing you to place the Tablo box where it makes the most sense in your home. Some choose to place the Tablo box near their router, some near their antennas and others right in their TV stands. How will I know if I can get good HDTV reception where I live?In general, those in major urban centers in Canada and the United States can be guaranteed to receive several free HDTV channels including most major networks. To find out exactly which channels you could receive at your house, visit www.tvfool.com for Canada or transition.fcc.gov/mb/engineering/dtvmaps/ for the US.The quality of your HDTV reception is based on proximity to HDTV broadcast towers, the type of antenna you’re using and its location (indoor, outdoor, height off the ground, direction). If you’re receiving less channels than you think you should be, try adjusting the location or direction of your antenna. What sort of channels can I get with Tablo?In the United States, customers in most areas will be able to get FOX, NBC, CBS, ABC, PBS, and CW networks. In Canada, most will be able to get CBC, CTV, Global, CityTV as well as regional and language-specific content. Canadians living close to the border may also be able to obtain signals from American networks. How much does it cost and how does that compare to other options?Once it's available to the public, Tablo’s cost will be comparable to other Over-The-Air (OTA) HDTV DVRs with external storage. Estimated street pricing will be in the range of $200 for the 2 Tuner edition and $250 for the 4 tuner edition. DVRs with internal storage will cost more due to the additional components required.To obtain program guide data, an additional fee of approximately $5-6 per month will be required (which is about half the cost of Netflix). Final pricing will depend several factors including the success of this campaign and market cost for the data itself. When compared to the average cost of a cable TV subscription (approximately $85 per month), consumers can expect to save around $2,000 over two years with Tablo.Competitors offering OTA HDTV with no hardware via broadband are less expensive but are only available in a few select markets in the US. Any plans to support DLNA receivers? eg. continuing to decline we believe they are a better option to deliver the
video  the final few inches to your TV.
One of the benefits of delivering video over your home network is that we can
