story:
Dear Funders, 13" STITX is now available!

Apologies for the confusion, we've modified the perks title to make it easier for you to select options. Please do not worry, if you've funded us before we updated, you will still receive your STITX and the only difference in the updated perks is the sizing. Please email us at askjacanything if you have any queries!

 

STITX is a sitck-on organizer for your belongings and gadgets necessary for work on-the-go bringing you convenience by sitting snugly at the back of your laptop, reducing the clutter of things on the already-tiny workspaces.  

 

The Problems

Busy lifestyles, rising costs of space, everyone's working on-the-go and there simply isn't enough room! Yet keys, wallets, phones and other essentials need a "home" when they're out of your pockets. 

  • Trouble finding your items?
  • Not enough space on your desk?
  • Too many things to carry?
  • Always working on-the-go?
  • Ever had to set up your little workstation at Starbucks or other coffee joints?
  • Need a mouse to work efficiently but it's too troublesome to bring out?
  • Always losing your thumb drive?

If you can relate to any of the above... We've the perfect solution for you! 

 

STITX

STITX made so slim, you can leave it on your laptop and still pop it into your bag effortlessly. 

 

Details

After countless configuration tryouts and prototyping on fabrics, we've finished designing STITX with the ideal technology and optimum materials to ensure a sleek frame and durability for a final prototype. We can now start stitching STITX for everyone!

STITX comes in 2 main colours. But if you're looking to customize your STITX? Now you can! Choose from our selection of 8 colours below and we'll make it for you! Limited Edition, 20 only! 

From Left-Right: Navy, Baby Blue, Violet, Yellow, Orange, Baby Pink, Maroon, Indigo 

  

POCKET STITX

If all you need is a little more space, here's Pocket STITX for you! 

Pocket STITX can be used with your iPad too.

 

Perks

 

Specifications 

Dimensions

Weight

15" STITX: 180g

13" STITX: 150g 

Pocket STITX: 30g

Materials Composition

Manufacturing Process

For precision, we laser cut every material to their exact dimensions before gluing them together then finally stitching them. Every STITX is made with utmost care and dedication as we manually cut, stamp and secure all the embellishments.
  

Made in Singapore 

Great products are made with love. Working hand-in-hand with Singapore bag-makers, STITX will have a handmade touch as they are carefully stitched together by our lovely seamstresses at Uyii.

 

Why Fund Us? 

Your funding will help us with the first production run of STITX as we need to meet a quota for material and manufacturing, so as to bring you STITX at an affordable price. We already have our manufacturer and suppliers ready to go, so all we need now is YOUR support. 

We hope to be able to make this a reality and deliver STITX into your hands, so please do spread the word and support us! Like us at: https://www.facebook.com/stitx :)

However, should our funding be unsuccessful and you would still like to receive STITX, please let us know! We'll be more than willing to make it for you.  

 

Media Coverage 

"...This is a serious smart solution to that "I can't find anything in my laptop bag" problem. This way you can lay out everything you need in visible pockets attached to the device you never leave home without."

 

"...STITX's stick-on organizer is taking a different and refreshing approach to combining old-school stationary comfort with our digital necessities."

"Introducing a brand new concept that revolutionises the idea of a personal workspace: STITX."

"ノマドワーカーには便利かも！ケーブルやマウス、鍵までノートパソコンと一緒に運べるよ！"

   

 

Timeline

Should our funding be successful, here's what we've planned ahead to bring STITX to you in the quickest possible manner. 

Mar- End Apr | Funding Successful! Celebrate!!

Mar- End Apr | Product Refinement & Packaging Design 

May- Early July | Production 

July | Start mailing out STITX!* 

 *There may be some delays in shipment and material supplies so please pardon us if STITX reaches you slightly later than expected.

 

FAQ

1. Will the adhesive dirty my laptop?

No, it will not as STITX can be removed and repositioned.


2. Do I have to remove it to put it in my bag? 

STITX has been designed to be flat when not in use, thus you can leave it on your laptop and slip it into your bag effortlessly. 

3. Where else can I buy STITX after your funding has ended? 

You may contact us at our email below. if you would like to purchase more after our funding has ended. 

4. If I'm a retailer, can I purchase in bulk? 

Yes, that can be arranged. Please contact us at our email for more information. 

5. Are there other colors? 

We're now offering a limited edition STITX in 8 other colours of Wool Felt! 

6. Can my Samsung S3 fit into Pocket STITX/ the phone compartment on STITX? 

Yes, STITX has been carefully measured to fit up to Samsung S3 

7. Is STITX stuck on by magnets? 

Nope, STITX is stuck on by an adhesive. But fret not, this adhesive leaves no residue and is repositionable! 

 

 

STITX Crew

The 3 of us are Industrial Design Majors at the National University of Singapore.

It started with us noticing a pattern in our observation of people with busy lifestyles that we came up with STITX as a solution to better organize our lives in a sleeker manner. And now, we have a chance to make this a reality with your support. 

Should you have any enquiries, you can contact us at: askjacanything
story_txt:
Dear Funders, 13" STITX is now available!
Apologies for the confusion, we've modified the perks title to make it easier for you to select options. Please do not worry, if you've funded us before we updated, you will still receive your STITX and the only difference in the updated perks is the sizing. Please email us at askjacanything if you have any queries!
 

STITX is a sitck-on organizer for your belongings and gadgets necessary for work on-the-go bringing you convenience by sitting snugly at the back of your laptop, reducing the clutter of things on the already-tiny workspaces.  
 
The Problems
Busy lifestyles, rising costs of space, everyone's working on-the-go and there simply isn't enough room! Yet keys, wallets, phones and other essentials need a "home" when they're out of your pockets. 

Trouble finding your items?
Not enough space on your desk?
Too many things to carry?
Always working on-the-go?
Ever had to set up your little workstation at Starbucks or other coffee joints?
Need a mouse to work efficiently but it's too troublesome to bring out?
Always losing your thumb drive?
If you can relate to any of the above... We've the perfect solution for you! 
 
STITX


STITX made so slim, you can leave it on your laptop and still pop it into your bag effortlessly. 
 
Details





After countless configuration tryouts and prototyping on fabrics, we've finished designing STITX with the ideal technology and optimum materials to ensure a sleek frame and durability for a final prototype. We can now start stitching STITX for everyone!


STITX comes in 2 main colours. But if you're looking to customize your STITX? Now you can! Choose from our selection of 8 colours below and we'll make it for you! Limited Edition, 20 only! 

From Left-Right: Navy, Baby Blue, Violet, Yellow, Orange, Baby Pink, Maroon, Indigo 
  
POCKET STITX

If all you need is a little more space, here's Pocket STITX for you! 

Pocket STITX can be used with your iPad too.
 
Perks

 
Specifications 
Dimensions


Weight
15" STITX: 180g
13" STITX: 150g 
Pocket STITX: 30g
Materials Composition

Manufacturing Process
For precision, we laser cut every material to their exact dimensions before gluing them together then finally stitching them. Every STITX is made with utmost care and dedication as we manually cut, stamp and secure all the embellishments.

However, should our funding be unsuccessful and you would still like to receive STITX, please let us know! We'll be more than willing to make it for you.

Mar- End Apr | Product Refinement & Packaging Design 
May- Early July | Production 
July | Start mailing out STITX!*

Yes, that can be arranged. Please contact us at our email for more information.

Yes, STITX has been carefully measured to fit up to Samsung S3

story:
Energy Production

 

 

 

 

 Devices  you can  chage with EnerJuice

Bring EnerJuice with you and charge your  devise with your motion

While you move, the internal battery of EnerJuice stores the energy  so you can use it  when you need it.

 

 

EnerJuice,  the best kinetic powerbank 

EnerJuice has considerably increased the power production compared to other standard kinetic devices. This is because standard kinetic chargers use the weight of the magnets to generate energy. EnerJuice instead  uses  the  weight of the battery togheter with the weight of the magnets to generate more power.

 

 

 

 

Test Results

We conducted the test of prototype's energy production with an oscilloscope (Hantek6022BE). We have reached good results but we want more! With customized components we could increase the efficiency of the devise.

 

 

 

CAD design of EnerJuice

 

 

 

 

EnerJuice Team


EnerJuice powerbank was founded by Alessio Santoro and Valeria Tatavitto with the contribution  of Pierluigi Venneri

 

Alessio Santoro is a Mechanical engineer with a huge passion for  engineering and inventions.  "I'm a curious person and when I watch something I always try to understand how  is made"

 

Valeria Tatavitto has a master degree in International & Political Science and several years of  experience in  marketing. "I came into the project by chance and I felt in love with this idea because I spend a lot of time outdoor  and EnerJuice  could really make my life easier"

 

Pierluigi Venneri has a degree in Informatics Engineering and  enxperience in  technology and web communication

 

Our team is passionate and determinate.  During the development of the project we had to overcome many obstacles but we never gave up. We believe in this idea and we want EnerJuice  to became available on the market.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Your contribution is fundamental to make  EnerJuice possible on industrial level. With the funds collected from the  campaign we are going to optimize Enerjuice with industrial customized components and to  start the pre-production phase. The current  power production of EnerJuice is based on a handmade prototype.  We think our technology could be used for different applications; it could be integrated inside the smartphone or the smartwatch  but we need to access to more sophisticated equipment to minimize the dimension e increase the efficiency.  We also would like to involve more people in our project.

 Wi will keep you update on the next steps.

 

 

 

Your Contribution

 

We are a small start-up and we have limited resources but unlimited creativity and willpower. Our home is also our laboratory;  we made most of the components ourselves thanks to our 3D printer and we are totally self-financing  the project. With your help we could have the economic resources to bring EnerJuice powerbank from a handmade  level  to an industrial level..

 

 

 

FAQ

 

Q. How long do I have to shake EnerJuice powerbank to charge my smartphone?

A. It depends on you; there is no limit: the more you shake it the more power you produce; with 1 minute shake you can have 2 minutes of call. If you shake it for more time you produce more energy.

 

Q. Do I have to plug my smartphone while I move?

A.  EneJuice is a powerbank,  it stores the energy while you shake it and while you move and you can use it when you need it.

 

Q. Can I charge EnerJuice powerbank to the  wall socket?

A. Yes, it's possible as you charge a regular powerbank.

 

Than You

 

We want to thank the people that help us to  go live on Indiegogo, our families and our friends.  Thank you  all,  we couldn't  have made it without you!

story:
This is ElySiUM

It is an

  • always on, low power, high contrast 4,3" E-Ink Display for your Moto Z
  • with touchscreen
  • and security technology for privacy and authentication.

You can

  • Read book in bright daylight
  • Read confidential Emails
  • Response without being eavesdropped by malicious app
  • and authenticate logins and transactions with secure two-factor authentication.

Including a SDK for App Development and Infrastructure Servers for the Authentication.

Description

The Moto Z is a smartphone built for fitting every imaginable requirement. Be it the possibility to transform it into a beamer or a sound blaster. But what if you merely want to enjoy a quiet evening, drink some wine while reading a novel? We got you covert. Simply attach the ElySiUM Mod to your Moto Z: A 4.3” capacitive multi-touch display - larger than the screen used in the iPhone 5. Read books, browse the web, even play games with the low energy E-Ink technology. Read and write emails in high contrast. All this without a blinding bright screen. Also enjoy its glare free high contrast in bright sunlight, on the beach or in the park.

Afraid that your Moto Z or the data on it gets stolen? You don't trust your virus detection software since all trojan horses and viruses evolve too fast? Reports about creditcard data stealing apps appear more and more. See 1,2,3 and many more news. But once the ElySiUM Mod is attached to your Moto Z you have a malware proof display available. Unavailable for malicous apps. Using our End-to-Display Encryption (E2DE), all data can be sent to it encrypted and will be never seen in plaintext on the Moto Zs processor, and therefor all its apps. Use a common crypto token to decrypt your data when required. Moreover it provides you a trojan proof two-factor authentication to identify yourself to any (web-)service.

Using a common standard, we currently support secure two-factor authentication to these platforms:

  • Google
  • Facebook
  • eBay
  • salesforce
  • Dropbox
  • GitHub 
  • and many others

These steps are required to perform an E2DE-supported two-factor authentication on the ElySiUM Mod:

  1. Go to your services login screen (on the Moto Z or another device)
  2. Receive an E2DE-encrypted challenge
  3. Plug your E2DE privacy SIM card into the ElySiUM Mod
  4. The decrypted challenge is displayed on the E-Ink
  5. Solve it using your second factor
  6. You are logged in

Create your own Apps

An essential feature developed within our campaign is the SDK that allows you to connect your apps to ElySiUM. Thereby you can easily create your own applications, which use the possibilities of the second screen and the security components.

Want some examples? Display status infos of the Moto Z without wasting battery; e.g. weather, clock, or missed calls. Interact with the E-Ink displays content to write emails or documents. How about a control interface for your smart home? Create more challanging games that use the E-Ink display as new gamelayer. Include secure factor authentication into your service using the E2DE-technology while increasing customers user experience. No matter what you do: The low power consumption of E-Inks will give you additional time!

Do you have a good idea? Want to sell it? Go for it! Get the developer edition in the perks. We can build 100 pre-production Mods and send them to you as soon as they are ready. These may not look like the final product, but they will work just like them. Together with the SDK, where you also get exclusive pre-release access, you can start the development sooner and be ready for market when we ship the rest of the Mods.

If you have a good idea, but you don’t want to develop it yourself? Contact us. We are always interested in good ideas and offer support / project coordination.

The SDK will be OpenSource (we did not yet decide the license, we will update you in time) as soon as we have a status ready for public access. So even if you wait for the non-developer edition, you will also be able to program for your Mod.

Status

Since 2012 we are researching in the area of the end-to-display encryption. Last year we started our first production run for the decryption chip, which will be part of ElySiUM. It is comparably easy to connect the technology to desktop PCs, but we always struggled to find a mobile platform, which can connect our security features, and still be secure. However, we started developing our E-Ink module in the beginning of 2016. Knowing, that an E-Ink attachment for smartphones may be the easiest way to add cool features to a smartphone. Of course, our solution should have a multi-touch capability. We achieved that requirement last year!

Implemented features

Upcoming we present you implemented features of the ElySiUM prototype. This section will be updated frequently during the campaign to inform you about the progress of the project.

We finalized the combination of the E-Ink display and capacitive touch as first important feature. The functionality is shown in the upcoming demonstration videos - please note the slow refresh rate of the display will be improved in the final design:

 

Current development: At the momement we implement the SDK to finalize the communication between apps running on the MotoZ and the ElySiUM Mod.

App Development

Parallel to the hardware implementations we developed the first apps for sharing, sending and receiving data from ElySiUM Mod. Right now, we are connecting these features with the Moto Z through the Moto Mod connectors.

We also showed a fully functional prototype for our authentication scheme. Enabling easy to remember but still strong two-factor authentication challenges.

Funding Goal and Schedule

First, we would like to point out, that we planned this campaign not to be a campaign to build a prototype. Our goal is to deliver the final product to all the backers of those rewards. For this, we spoke with suppliers and already have most of the pricing for calculations. Because of this, we also know that due to most parts having a minimum order quantity, we are not able to activate the flexible funding option. Our supporters already help us building the prototype regardless of the campaign.

Our prototyping phase is almost finished. However, a big hike is still ahead of us. The manufacturing, designing the enclosures and packaging, sourcing materials, finding producers and suppliers. We already have a large number of parts ready for order and some we will manufacture to our specification.

Additionally, we have to get FCC and CE Certification, as well as Motorola Approval for the final product. These tests also include EMV testing. For the authentication method over FIDO we also have to be certified.

Here is a graphic, how we will use the funds we hope to receive in this campaign. All shares have their respective buffer if something unplanned happens, which often happens.

Fees & Royalties are shares we have to pay to Indiegogo and Motorola for using the platforms and the licensing.

Extended Goals

Of course we have some more ideas for the ElySiUM Mod. Should we reach more than 3.000 backed units(200%), we will make the ElySiUM Wireless! We add a battery and low-energy wireless controller to our ciruit for free. This will make the Mod usable without the attached Moto Z. You could read an email while on the phone. Or surf the web while your kid plays a game on the Moto Z.

Schedule

We already started the development, so given here are some milestones when we want to finish with the tasks and ship the final products.

Team

We are a startup from the computer science department of the university of Tuebingen in Germany, where we research and build embedded, mobile and webbased systems. As part of our research we developed the end-to-display encryption.

Sebastian Burg (mid), Founder and CEO of bollwrk. Researcher at Embedded Systems Chair University Tuebingen since 2011. Researching IT Security Technology since 2012. Founding Member of Startup Stuttgart e.V.

Stefan Müller (right), Co-Founder and CTO of bollwrk. Researcher at Embedded Systems Chair University of Tuebingen since 2012. Embedded Developer since 2001.

Kevin Körner (left), Co-Founder and CMO of bollwrk. Researcher at Information Systems Chair University of Tuebingen since 2012.

We are supported by the University of Tuebingen. Our technology was in the final round of the 5. IT Security Competition in 2014. We also were selected at the Europractice First User Program 2016 for 10 out of 90 candidates to receive an free chip fabrication run.

Risks and Challenges

We are confident in our ability to produce our ElySiUMMods given the successful funding. But, there are some parts in the process we can’t yet foresee. These are for example the quality and availability of parts manufactured and ordered. These may or may not be within the high standard we want to ship to our costumers. Therefore it may be necessary to reorder or extend the timings for these parts.

Further has the product to be certified for the import into the US and the EU. These processes can only be marginally planed. Resulting in not plannable delays.

We planned with a fair amount of buffer for either price and time, but those buffers may be calculated to narrow and may even result in an unsuccessful production. As these processes and parts are brand new, this is the case for all Mods currently developed.

Shipping Restrictions

Please note that we may not be able to ship to your country due to shipping restrictions. We will probably ship with DHL, so if they ship to your Country from Germany, than that should be ok, if there are no embargos against your country in place.

We also showed a fully functional prototype for our authentication scheme. Enabling easy to remember but still strong two-factor authentication challenges.

Funding Goal and Schedule
First, we would like to point out, that we planned this campaign not to be a campaign to build a prototype. Our goal is to deliver the final product to all the backers of those rewards. For this, we spoke with suppliers and already have most of the pricing for calculations. Because of this, we also know that due to most parts having a minimum order quantity, we are not able to activate the flexible funding option. Our supporters already help us building the prototype regardless of the campaign.
Our prototyping phase is almost finished. However, a big hike is still ahead of us. The manufacturing, designing the enclosures and packaging, sourcing materials, finding producers and suppliers. We already have a large number of parts ready for order and some we will manufacture to our specification.
Additionally, we have to get FCC and CE Certification, as well as Motorola Approval for the final product. These tests also include EMV testing. For the authentication method over FIDO we also have to be certified.
Here is a graphic, how we will use the funds we hope to receive in this campaign. All shares have their respective buffer if something unplanned happens, which often happens.

Fees & Royalties are shares we have to pay to Indiegogo and Motorola for using the platforms and the licensing.
Extended Goals
Of course we have some more ideas for the ElySiUM Mod. Should we reach more than 3.000 backed units(200%), we will make the ElySiUM Wireless! We add a battery and low-energy wireless controller to our ciruit for free. This will make the Mod usable without the attached Moto Z. You could read an email while on the phone. Or surf the web while your kid plays a game on the Moto Z.
Schedule
We already started the development, so given here are some milestones when we want to finish with the tasks and ship the final products.

Team
We are a startup from the computer science department of the university of Tuebingen in Germany, where we research and build embedded, mobile and webbased systems. As part of our research we developed the end-to-display encryption.

Sebastian Burg (mid), Founder and CEO of bollwrk. Researcher at Embedded Systems Chair University Tuebingen since 2011. Researching IT Security Technology since 2012. Founding Member of Startup Stuttgart e.V.
Stefan Müller (right), Co-Founder and CTO of bollwrk. Researcher at Embedded Systems Chair University of Tuebingen since 2012. Embedded Developer since 2001.
Kevin Körner (left), Co-Founder and CMO of bollwrk. Researcher at Information Systems Chair University of Tuebingen since 2012.
We are supported by the University of Tuebingen. Our technology was in the final round of the 5. IT Security Competition in 2014. We also were selected at the Europractice First User Program 2016 for 10 out of 90 candidates to receive an free chip fabrication run.
Risks and Challenges
We are confident in our ability to produce our ElySiUMMods given the successful funding. But, there are some parts in the process we can’t yet foresee. These are for example the quality and availability of parts manufactured and ordered. These may or may not be within the high standard we want to ship to our costumers. Therefore it may be necessary to reorder or extend the timings for these parts.
Further has the product to be certified for the import into the US and the EU. These processes can only be marginally planed. Resulting in not plannable delays.
We planned with a fair amount of buffer for either price and time, but those buffers may be calculated to narrow and may even result in an unsuccessful production. As these processes and parts are brand new, this is the case for all Mods currently developed.
Shipping Restrictions
Please note that we may not be able to ship to your country due to shipping restrictions. We will probably ship with DHL, so if they ship to your Country from Germany, than that should be ok, if there are no embargos against your country in place.

story:
Our Finger Server Hardware is based on the same technology as the Raspberry Pi and is a complement to the Pi.

The Finger Server - Digit 1 is geared towards students and hobbyists in the maker movement.

A Finger Server is a portable, educational network device for programming applications, data processing and storage.


This graphic is a artist rendering, you will receive an actual motherboard with a RJ45 tip.

Our mission with the finger server is to provide affordable servers to students, to learn the principals of server technology.



_____________________________________________________________________

The Finger Server has a Micro USB and Mico HDMI connectors for a keyboard, Mouse and monitor.
We include a simple 1,2,3 go instruction sheet .  Remember you can Code in any language.

_____________________________________________________________________

Simply plug into a POE switch. It’s powered and on your network.

______________________________________________________________________


We cant wait for our next production run of 4096! So you can enjoy multiple Finger Servers!

______________________________________________________________________

Size: 14mm wide x approx. 100mm long Depends on final Engineering. We need to give them some adjustment room.

Shroud / Cover: the first run of 256 units / 4096  will not have a cover

______________________________________________________________________


The Funds will go to the required engineering from a engineering design firm. This is in two stages first Schematic stage and then the printed board design. Then we will complete the first 20 prototypes. Work out any kinks before proceeding to to our 256 units! We have spent the last ten months full time on this project on design, mock ups, our video and working out the parts, vendors and assembly house. All funds go directly to engineering and production costs and perks.
______________________________________________________________________

For a Finger Server we will use a protective anti-static bag inside a bubble bag.
For a kit everything will be packed firmly inside a box.

story:
Click Here to Pre-order or buy a Bluetooth Alarm Clock or to find out more about our Bluetooth Alarm Clock App.

aclock Features 

aclock has several features that make it the best bedside alarm clock you can buy:

  • Backlit E-ink Display, (like a kindle) high visibility and low power.
  • Tap to illuminate at night - pleasing low brightness backlight
  • Double tap to snooze
  • Shake to turn off alarm
  • Adjust time, multiple alarms, snooze time on the iOS App, Android coming soon
  • Bluetooth low energy for background sync up to 60 feet away
  • Multiple alarms per day at different times each day
  • 1 year battery life
  • Free companion App 


HEX3 has also developed  the following products:

JaJa iPad Stylus

The JaJa is the Worlds Best Pressure Sensitive Stylus for iPads

Works on ALL iPads - 1, 2, 3, 4, AIR and Mini

JaJa senses how hard you push against the screen and converts this pressure into a smooth brush stroke that varies in thickness and opacity - just like a real brush or pen.

Nota Stylus for iPad 

The Nota is a Fine point stylus for iPad and Android Tablets.

The Nota fine point stylus is an active stylus so it works when wearing gloves.

YuFu Fine Point iPad Stylus

The YuFu is the worlds best range of iPad stylii. Multiple colors, and 3 models to choose from. 1.9mm tip, brush tip, rubber tip - your choice. 

The Yufu Pro for serious artists and perfectionists 4000 levels of pressure sensitivity, tilt, and accuracy - Bluetooth 4.

The YuFu Focus for advanced note taking and sketching, perfect for education and business 

The YuFu for notes and sketching - the stylus for iPad and Android tablets - basic function, but high quality

story:
Personal communication and entertainment device production has exploded in recent years and will continue to increase in popularity. This wave of technology has brought about device management issues, specifically, how to organize and charge all these devices. I have been a consultant for many electronics companies over the past 20 years, designing and developing many products.  I recognized the need for an organized, centrally located charging facility and developed the Universal Multi-Port Chargers.

The Universal Multi Charger series was created for our ever growing obsession with mobile electronics and the need to charge them all at the same time in one location properly.  I was tired of having different charging adapters all over the house in different rooms charging different devices because I needed more wall sockets.  My wife would clean house some mornings and put my cables with devices away in a draw and after a while I forgot which adapter went with what device.  The success of tablet adapters further complicated the charging problem.  No longer were chargers for devices interchangeable because tablets took more current wattage then phones, Mp3s etc. 

There are currently on the market only a few docking/charging products, but they can only charge a few items, and are device specific, like Apple's iHome, which can only charge Apple products.  Our chargers can charge all devices, including phones, tablets, games, headsets, etc that have a USB charging plug, and can charge up to three times more than comparable current marketed products.  Our projected price points are competitively priced against the competition.

Even though my iPhone and iPad adapter looked the same, they both charge at different rates of electrical current so when I mixed them up they would not both charge at the fastest rate properly.  This was also true with some other mobile devices I had.   I did some research and found out that most adapters only charge at one rate and is made for one device only and if I accidentally switched them up, they would not charge properly.  So I worked with some electrical engineers and helped developed a chip that would recognize and always provide the correct electrical current automatically no matter what the device current requirements.  We call this SCD (Smart Current Detection) technology.

With your help, I can bring this product to you and your friends, families and relatives.  If you can't contribute and receive these new unique products, tell your friends and family for me.  Get the word out about these great devices that will solve the problems of multiple device charging and organizing.

I am in the final stages of developing and manufacturing these exciting new products for charging smart phones and personal devices. This project includes three products all designed around a technology to provide the fastest possible charge without over charging device batteries. An added attribute is an attractive full feature alarm clock. 

Currently, I've invested over $100K and need working capital to purchase parts and factory time. The moulds for two of the products along with the electronics are complete. Hand made samples have been sent to BV for ETL and FCC certification. 

The following three steps describe the remaining process: 

1) Order parts and components including: plastic material for moulds, speakers, transformers, amplifiers and printed circuit boards. 

2) Print retail boxes, manuals, reading inserts and create poly-foam packing inserts. 

3) Schedule factory time for production. 

Funds must be in place to order parts and printing before a factory will schedule production. I'm offering attractive perks in exchange for your participation. I hope you're as eager as I am to finish this project and send you your new multi-charger products, and get the word out to the world about how to end their charging frustrations! 

If we fall short of our goal, we wills till be able to fulfill the perks we ahve offered to those who contribute, although it might be a slight delay.

Thank you for your time and contribution!

story:
What is QDRIVE?


QDRIVE is a smartphone-driven vehicle immobilizer, whereby starting the car automatically locks the phone's screen.  

It's designed to not only stop texting and driving, much like Breathalyzer immobilizers do with drunk drivers, but provide proof to insurance companies that the policy holder cannot text and drive, justifying lower insurance premiums.


Features Of The App

Phone Lockout: 
The biggest feature of QDRIVE is smartphone lockout controlled by vehicle ignition. This feature is designed to block the user from mobile input during driving by requiring lockout in order to start the vehicle.


Valet Mode:

Literally, no one can start your car now without locking out their phone, but don't worry, we'll built in the back end for user-ability without compromise.  Share your ride with valet mode. Simply set a timer, walk away, and let someone else do the driving. As a precautionary measure, the timer will prematurely end when the user's device reconnects.



Additional Features


Circumvention Prevention:

Where the App can stop you, it will.  Where the app cannot defend itself, it will report you.  It is a simple mechanism of QDRIVE will stop you, or catch you.

Where phone use cannot be locked out (someone bypasses the App, iOS constraints) an exception report is sent our QDRIVE server.  Should anomalies occur in the exception reporting (multiple battery removals, abuse of valet mode, etc.), SYNQ reports the abuse and potential risk to the parent (if applicable), insuring party and/or governing road safety authority.


Road Safety and Insurance Premiums:

Rear end collisions are on the rise, and in addition, personal injuries claims as a result of rear end collision have reached an all-time high.  Very few drivers are implicated in charges or refusals of insurance coverage when a Smartphone contributes to an accident.  Police generally do not attend in instances of rear end collisions, the exact scenarios where Smartphones are the leading cause. 

People are not rear ending people at 15 and 20km (6-10mph) anymore, they are rear ending folks at 50km (30mph).  Why?  There is no reaction time, they are rear ending people with their eyes in their lap.


What We Need & What You Get

QDrive needs your help to succeed in making the roads safer. If we reach our goal, we will push to deliver by May 2015.  Your funds will help us develop more robust software and hardware so we can get QDrive ready for road use.


What sets QDrive ahead of the competition?

Currently, all Smartphone while Driving mitigation technologies (apps) recognize an event (generally speed of travel), and then prompt the user to lockout.  For all apps that rely on speed of travel, their solution will always be reactionary; reacting to an occurring event.

As a result, this assumption, must build in back doors and exits for those in passenger seats or using transit.  

Now ask yourself a question, 

Patent Pending:

A patent has been submitted and update has been made to that patent during the course of prototype development.  

Legislation:

We’ve brought this in front of Provincial and Federal government members of parliament in Canada, and their response was that this should be part of legislation as a driver rehabilitation initiative for distracted driving.  Stay tuned for our updates.

Partnerships:

Those with partnership inquiries regarding telematics, remote vehicle start, vehicle alarm, can contact SYNQ at qdrive@synqtech.com

The Impact

We ourselves admit, it can be really challenging sometimes not to check out that text, that email, that NFL notification.  Like a lot of things we shouldn’t do, unless someone stops us, we’re going to continue that activity.  

We all agree, Smartphones are addictive, and using them while driving is danagerous…QDRIVE is the solution.


Risks & Challenges

Feasibility of iOS and Windows Phone:
Lockout functionality on iOS and Windows Phone is currently not possible due to existing limitations of the operating system. We are currently exploring other ways of reporting mobile use as a workaround, such as logging time spent outside of the QDrive app.


OBD Port:

We're currently working on reducing installation strain by powering and connecting the module via the OBD port.  Many obstacles are needed to overcome not from starter interlock, but, the circumvention concerns of the user simply 'pulling the plug'.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, don't worry about it. Help spread the news by sharing our video and this Indiegogo page. Most importantly, help end this epidemic of texting and driving by discouraging your friends, family, and yourself from texting and driving.

We don't need to treat this topic with doom and gloom, scare tactics...let's work the solution out, from young drivers, schools, leading by example and insurance companies.

Share this link: 

http://youtu.be/I_NcLkzXP-c?list=UU-Lw3c2Z7OpeS5rqrw79hrQ

FAQ:

What if I lost my phone?  What if you lost your keys?  We know exactly how important phones are to us in our lives, soon they will replace our wallets.  QDRIVE is just one more reason to ensure you have your phone at all times.

What if my Smartphone battery is dead?  Charge it in your car via cigarette lighter.

What if I get a new phone?  If the app does not transition over to your phone via cloud or computer sync (of the operating support system of your phone’s OS), it will be remembered in the app store where you originally downloaded it.  You will always want to ensure you update your account with QDRIVE when you have a new phone to ensure your EMEI code matches that on file with us.

What if I want to let someone borrow my car?  Downloading the app is free.  Just provide them with the Bluetooth password for app connectivity.

If someone cracked the Bluetooth password, could they now steal my car?  Your keys are still required to start and run your car, this is simply an immobilizer component.

Will my other Bluetooth devices still work for hands free?  Yes, all Bluetooth devices still work even while being Bluetooth paired to QDRIVE.

Can I use GPS still?  If your administrative functions are not restricted, the GPS direction will read aloud, however, no screen images will display in order to truly reduce the visual distractions of smart phones.

I am the mother of a new driver, can I lock out hands free devices as they are illegal for new drivers in my state/province?  Yes, as the administrator of the hardware, you allow for users to have hands free device functionality or not.  This is customizable, driver profile to driver profile.

What if I have a dead vehicle battery?  You go through the same routine if you had a dead car battery without QDRIVE, however, must use QDRIVE in order to trigger starter.

I have a Blackberry, will this work?  Yes, Blackberries will be supported via the Android application.

I have a windows phone, will this work?  Relatively same functionality as iOS?

What about Telematics?  We look to launch an optional update in the future following the release of QDRIVE with integrated telematics.  Stay tuned.  

What are Telematics?  Telematics are GPS metrics on steroids.  Not only do they show geographic data associated with GPS, but how a person go there including speed (include acceleration and deceleration), rapid lane change, etc.

Does my remote start function still work?  With some vehicle start programs, you may need to lockout first (you will have approximately 30’ communication between your QDRIVE and your phone).  

How much is the service if I want to continue after the first year?  Annual subscription services for consumer use are $49.95, for fleet and business the charge is $199.95 per business, plus $59.95 per vehicle.

What happens if I don’t subscribe the following year?  We will be unable to provide proof of use, and if you have an insurance credit, you may no longer be eligible.  

Insurance reduction?  We’ve worked with many of the leading insurance companies in Canada and the USA, getting feedback on what the greatest driving risks are and if a preventable solution were available, would they give a discount?  The response by and large was an overwhelming yes.  Because apps using speed of travel as an indicator of driving cannot ‘enforce’ someone to use the app (passenger/transit), there isn’t a risk mitigation component to the strategy.  Essentially, having someone use a voluntary app with a backdoor for passengers and transit, is the same as saying “Do you pinky swear you won’t use your Smartphone when you drive?  Then here is your discount”.  Because QDRIVE requires an active phone to start the car, 

Who can I speak with regarding an adjustment on my insurance premium?  We ask that you get involved with the QDRIVE community in order to reduce premiums for those using QDRIVE.  We will provide certificates of use for all current QDRIVE subscription holders.  QDRIVE is the only provable technology that the policy holder isn't using their phone.  Never will a speed of travel app be able to do this.

GM Ignition issues vs. Immobilizers?  The critical difference between an ignition switch and an immobilizer is that an immobilizer cannot turn a vehicle off, rather, it can only prohibit a vehicle from starting (prevents vehicle starter from receiving signal/power).

On February 7, 2014, General Motors (GM) recalled about 800,000 of its small cars due to faulty ignition switches, which could shut off the engine during driving and thereby prevent the airbags from inflating.

In this instance, the ignition was faulty and ‘turning off’ the vehicle whereas QDRIVE does not have the ability to do so.  The only thing QDRIVE can do is prevent a vehicle from starting, not turning it off.

What about automotive legislation requirements for QDRIVE?  In Canada, automobiles are now equipped with immobilization technology via chipped keys, active RFID fobs, and for older cars, aftermarket immobilizers meeting ULC-S.338 standard under Transport Canada's National Standard CMVSS114.  In the USA, a similar picture, but rather 49 USC CHAPTER 331.  

These legislative requirements have been developed as minimum guidelines (of which in today’s sophisticated security realm, are very minimum).  QDRIVE will be approved by an accredited laboratory (e.g. CSA, UL), for the appropriate standard of both Canada and the USA (further countries to be explored) to ensure that if this is the only immobilizer mechanism (older model cars), that it meets the legislated standard.  Currently, there is no legislation in place for a relatively new concept of having multiple layers of immobilization.

Great, but who's this SYNQ?

We are SYNQ ACCESS + SECURITY TECHNOLOGY (www.synqtech.com) and we’ve been building security tech solutions for retail and commercial applications for years.  Our team is comprised of tech developers, installers, and licensed field agents (retail crime response team).

We’ve developed multiple EAS (electronic article surveillance) systems and specialized tags for the retail grocery vertical, as well as integrating, building, installing and servicing the highest quality CCTV systems in the country (4k cameras, 360TB CCTV servers).

We hold patents in industries from security tech in retail, commercial building, and now automotive safety and security.

Our passion is improved safety, and what gives our success is reducing risk for our clients and insurance!  Our company’s success stems from developing solutions attractive to insurance companies and underwriting, saving our clients money, demonstrating reduced risk.   

Meet Our Team

We're currently working on reducing installation strain by powering and connecting the module via the OBD port.  Many obstacles are needed to overcome not from starter interlock, but, the circumvention concerns of the user simply 'pulling the plug'.

Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, don't worry about it. Help spread the news by sharing our video and this Indiegogo page. Most importantly, help end this epidemic of texting and driving by discouraging your friends, family, and yourself from texting and driving.
We don't need to treat this topic with doom and gloom, scare tactics...let's work the solution out, from young drivers, schools, leading by example and insurance companies.
Share this link: 



http://youtu.be/I_NcLkzXP-c?list=UU-Lw3c2Z7OpeS5rqrw79hrQ


FAQ:

What if I lost my phone?  What if you lost your keys?  We know exactly how important phones are to us in our lives, soon they will replace our wallets.  QDRIVE is just one more reason to ensure you have your phone at all times.
What if my Smartphone battery is dead?  Charge it in your car via cigarette lighter.
What if I get a new phone?  If the app does not transition over to your phone via cloud or computer sync (of the operating support system of your phone’s OS), it will be remembered in the app store where you originally downloaded it.  You will always want to ensure you update your account with QDRIVE when you have a new phone to ensure your EMEI code matches that on file with us.
What if I want to let someone borrow my car?  Downloading the app is free.  Just provide them with the Bluetooth password for app connectivity.
If someone cracked the Bluetooth password, could they now steal my car?  Your keys are still required to start and run your car, this is simply an immobilizer component.
Will my other Bluetooth devices still work for hands free?  Yes, all Bluetooth devices still work even while being Bluetooth paired to QDRIVE.
Can I use GPS still?  If your administrative functions are not restricted, the GPS direction will read aloud, however, no screen images will display in order to truly reduce the visual distractions of smart phones.
I am the mother of a new driver, can I lock out hands free devices as they are illegal for new drivers in my state/province?  Yes, as the administrator of the hardware, you allow for users to have hands free device functionality or not.  This is customizable, driver profile to driver profile.
What if I have a dead vehicle battery?  You go through the same routine if you had a dead car battery without QDRIVE, however, must use QDRIVE in order to trigger starter.
I have a Blackberry, will this work?  Yes, Blackberries will be supported via the Android application.
I have a windows phone, will this work?  Relatively same functionality as iOS?
What about Telematics?  We look to launch an optional update in the future following the release of QDRIVE with integrated telematics.  Stay tuned.  
What are Telematics?  Telematics are GPS metrics on steroids.  Not only do they show geographic data associated with GPS, but how a person go there including speed (include acceleration and deceleration), rapid lane change, etc.
Does my remote start function still work?  With some vehicle start programs, you may need to lockout first (you will have approximately 30’ communication between your QDRIVE and your phone).  
How much is the service if I want to continue after the first year?  Annual subscription services for consumer use are $49.95, for fleet and business the charge is $199.95 per business, plus $59.95 per vehicle.
What happens if I don’t subscribe the following year?  We will be unable to provide proof of use, and if you have an insurance credit, you may no longer be eligible.  
Insurance reduction?  We’ve worked with many of the leading insurance companies in Canada and the USA, getting feedback on what the greatest driving risks are and if a preventable solution were available, would they give a discount?  The response by and large was an overwhelming yes.  Because apps using speed of travel as an indicator of driving cannot ‘enforce’ someone to use the app (passenger/transit), there isn’t a risk mitigation component to the strategy.  Essentially, having someone use a voluntary app with a backdoor for passengers and transit, is the same as saying “Do you pinky swear you won’t use your Smartphone when you drive?  Then here is your discount”.  Because QDRIVE requires an active phone to start the car, 
Who can I speak with regarding an adjustment on my insurance premium?  We ask that you get involved with the QDRIVE community in order to reduce premiums for those using QDRIVE.  We will provide certificates of use for all current QDRIVE subscription holders.  QDRIVE is the only provable technology that the policy holder isn't using their phone.  Never will a speed of travel app be able to do this.
GM Ignition issues vs. Immobilizers?  The critical difference between an ignition switch and an immobilizer is that an immobilizer cannot turn a vehicle off, rather, it can only prohibit a vehicle from starting (prevents vehicle starter from receiving signal/power).
On February 7, 2014, General Motors (GM) recalled about 800,000 of its small cars due to faulty ignition switches, which could shut off the engine during driving and thereby prevent the airbags from inflating.
In this instance, the ignition was faulty and ‘turning off’ the vehicle whereas QDRIVE does not have the ability to do so.  The only thing QDRIVE can do is prevent a vehicle from starting, not turning it off.
What about automotive legislation requirements for QDRIVE?  In Canada, automobiles are now equipped with immobilization technology via chipped keys, active RFID fobs, and for older cars, aftermarket immobilizers meeting ULC-S.338 standard under Transport Canada's National Standard CMVSS114.  In the USA, a similar picture, but rather 49 USC CHAPTER 331.  
These legislative requirements have been developed as minimum guidelines (of which in today’s sophisticated security realm, are very minimum).  QDRIVE will be approved by an accredited laboratory (e.g. CSA, UL), for the appropriate standard of both Canada and the USA (further countries to be explored) to ensure that if this is the only immobilizer mechanism (older model cars), that it meets the legislated standard.  Currently, there is no legislation in place for a relatively new concept of having multiple layers of immobilization.
Great, but who's this SYNQ?

We are SYNQ ACCESS + SECURITY TECHNOLOGY (www.synqtech.com) and we’ve been building
security tech solutions for retail and commercial applications for years.  Our team is comprised of tech
developers, installers, and licensed field agents (retail crime response team).

We’ve developed multiple EAS (electronic article
surveillance) systems and specialized tags for the retail grocery vertical, as
well as integrating, building, installing and servicing the highest quality
CCTV systems in the country (4k cameras, 360TB CCTV servers).


We hold patents in industries from security tech in retail,
commercial building, and now automotive safety and security.


Our passion is improved safety, and what gives our success is
reducing risk for our clients and insurance!  Our company’s success stems from developing solutions
attractive to insurance companies and underwriting, saving our clients money,
demonstrating reduced risk.   


Meet Our Team

story:
What is unique with Four4?

The main reason the idea was brought to life is that i have never been satisfied with multi port chargers. They are built with cheap components and lack functions that i believe are prerequisite for safe and smart charging. Many of them are told to deliver high power but when they are put to the test, many of them fail in different aspects. Throttling the power output is most common, overheating or having very high voltage ripple are issues often found! 

So I decided to design a charger having all safety functions possible including data integrity protection. It delivers the specified power, has a innovative touch sensor as UI and a display showing important charging and system information. 

 

 

 

Data integrity protection/ Firewall

Use the Four4 as a standalone power splitter and USB condom. If you often charge your devices in public USB outlets you are always exposed for data intrusion and harmful spyware! Four4 isolates the data communication between your device and the public outlet. It analyses so that the USB voltage is within the correct limits before enabling charging to your device.  To connect the Four4 to a public outlet use a standard USB to DC jack adapter cable. 

 

 

Information is vital

The OLED display can be used to see if charging is ongoing but with time, the user will probably use it even more to monitor each channel, and make sure that charging is optimized. A good example is that you can compare different USB cables and how they affect charging current and time. You will be able to sort out good and bad cables. 

  •  Input voltage. Check if you have correct input voltage. If it's on the lower end it will affect charging
  •  Total power. Get information of how much power is delivered by the Four4
  •  Current. Charging current for each channel is presented. Note that if current is below 100mA it's considered as maintenance charging and not shown in display
  •  Active port. Active ports are marked with a pointer
  •  Temperature. Show internal charger temperature with 5 degree resolution
  •  Charging indicator.  Battery bar showing that charging is ongoing

 

Always full power

All 4 channels are independent and each channel optimizes the charging current to be as high as possible to the connected device. Maximum current per channel is 2A. When many multi port devices throttle the power, Four4 will deliver 2A in each channel simultaneously.  

The Four4 can also be used as a 5V power supply to any non intelligent device and can deliver up to 3.2A/ port.  Only two ports with each 3.2A can be used at the same time. The two remaining ports will share 1.6A still available. 

 

 

Compatible with most single board computers

Four4 is the perfect power supply for most single board computers. It delivers clean high power without any disruption. The 3.2 power supply mode can deal with the most power demanding board! 

 

 

                

 

Why ECO design

There are two aspect of the Four4 Eco design philosophy.

  • Local manufacturing gives total control of the total product chain. Four4 is manufactured in Sweden by Alma Electronics. Only high quality components from well known suppliers are used. The charger has gone thru extensive testing with very good results. This increases chances for a product lasting long and not becoming electronic waste shortly after purchase. Four4 will ship from local storage, which results in shorter travel distances that are less carbon-intensive. All this reduces the environmental footprint. The factory follow Swedish employment laws and the working conditions are high!
  • The charger is designed to have as high efficiency as possible. As much power as possible is delivered into the connected devices. Therefore the whole system is powered with 5V and have extremely low internal resistance. The total power loss when charging at full power is around 2.5%

As a result of the low internal resistance the heat that is developed in the charger is one of the lowest on the market. Measurements below show the heat maps when charging with 40W for more than 3h, in 25°C / 77°F ambient temperature. The hottest spot internally is 59°C / 132°F and externally 39°C / 102°F. 

 

 

Development journey

Since the idea was born many prototypes were built and rejected. Both electronics, mechanics and software has been redesigned several times to achieve the desired quality. The product has matured to that state that several beta testers have used it for months without any complaints! 

 

Extensive verification and redesigns based on best measurements has resulted in components from the suppliers below. 

Featured on

 

 

Feedback from early testers 

#Johan: "I bought an electronic device that i charged with Four4. After 2.5h of charging, it was still charging with 1W, according to the display. The device itself had shown that it was fully charged more than one hour ago.  Without the display I wouldn't know that the device actually never stops charging with the risk of over charging."

#Caroline: "My main task was to test the charger on the go and connect it to public USB outlets. I tried a public outlet at a train station and the Four4 stated that USB voltage was to high! Tried to reconnect several times with same result. So happy I didn't connect my phone directly to the outlet."

 

Charger specifications 

 

 

Perk options 

Timeline

Risks and challenges

The product itself is very mature and heavily tested with no remarks! Main issues are component supply, manufacturing and logistics. These are always considered as a risk when dealing with a product. As the world deals with Corona the risks of delivering in time are even higher. I have tried to minimize the risks as much as possible by using standard of the shelf components and local manufacturing. I have had alot of communication with the factory and no bigger issues can be expected regarding delivery time. Also time to delivery is on our side. Hopefully the world has better control of the virus sometime around late summer!

story:
What is StereoClip and how does it work?

Simple design, smart solution – this is what we aim at! So at a glance the StereoClip is not really different from a normal clip or little badge on your clothes. The product consists of a pair of clips with specific design working as follows:

  • One clip is used to fasten the earphones in the upper part of your clothes, ensuring that they don’t fall down and the cable doesn’t bounce around.
  • The other clip is fastened either to the bottom part of your t-shirt, belt buckle of your pants, your pocket, bag or wherever is the place you hold your mobile phone or MP3 player.
  • You stretch the cable between the 2 clips so it isn’t bouncy and leave as much as you want before the upper clip.

Thus weather you put the cable under your clothes or above them it won’t bounce, the earphones won’t fall on the ground and you have an easy way of storing the earphones on your clothes when not in use. Nice, right?!

Usage and benefits:

  • Fitting The StereoClip to the top part of your clothes prevents cable's tension resulting in discomfort and weariness in your ears!
  • Fitting second StereoClip to the bottom part of the clothes, pockets or bag stretches the cable and keeps it fit to the body giving freedom of movement without worrying about falling earphones or phone/player!

And more - helping with the tangled cable of the phones...


 


How did we think of The StereoClip?

The StereoClip is a pretty simple, yet highly functional decision the idea for which came to us while jogging or biking with earphones on. Among the the most annoying things during such activities are:

  • the earphones cable bouncing around when it is out;
  • the cable occasionally unplugging the phones when it is under the clothes;
  • very often the phones fell on the ground due to lack of proper way of securing them to the clothes, pockets and of course the ears;

This was the moment! We needed something to help fasten securely our earphones, yet allowing us to move freely without the uncomfortable movement of the cable. We tried solving the problem with simple everyday items but there was still something missing. So we sat down and decided to design something simple and lightweight to solve the problem. Thus The StereoClip was born!

Who are we?

We are a team of two professionals each with specific experience in different field.

I am Vladimir Vladimirov – business consultant with more than a hundred successful business and EU funded projects, developed for different companies among which are banks, manufacturing companies and service providers in our home country Bulgaria

The other member of our team is Kalin Georgiev – a professional designer with extensive experience in interior design, 3D design of furniture and other products, photography enthusiast and keen biker. Kalin has a good track record in projects for SPA centers, interior design and furniture for offices as well as the design of personal apartments.

Both of us have succeeded in implementing projects for different clients and up to this moment our job was to help people make their ideas happen. But we decided it is time to bring our own crazy idea to life. We have many friends with start-ups and we grew passionate of establishing one ourselves.

We are committed to deliver!

We have helped companies to bring dozens of projects and products to market over a period of 7 years. These happened both through licensing and through acting as the intermediary with the manufacturer. We have serious experience with every aspect of the process. We have a track record of success and are committed to integrity and excellence. Most of all we are passionate and want to make things happen.

Why Indiegogo?

We as individuals or part of other companies typically work on other people's amazing ideas and designs to help bring them to the market. We have worked with many contractors and established contacts in the manufacturing industry due to our previous experience. Thinking of new and innovative things sometimes makes us wonder how we can facilitate our everyday life with simple design but yet smart concept decisions. Thus we are now at the stage where we are excited and crave for the challenge of making our own item to sell.

We believe crowdfunding will allow us to produce our very own product, rather than licensing it to another manufacturer - again. Being in charge of the whole process will ensure that the product we offer will live up to our vision and our perception of real quality implementation.

How did it go so far?

We developed the The StereoClip using an iterative design process that started with a lot of sketches and included more than a dozen 3D printed prototypes, and several different designs so far. Here is how it all happened:

From sketches...

... to 3D design ...

... to different prototype designs ...


... 3D printed prototypes ...

... to our final model so far ...

and as a result the 3D design vs the final sample...

So far we have tested the design and functionality of the product but there is still some work to be done in March 2016. We will keep updates if any changes occur.

Technical specifications


The StereoClip is made of injection molded high quality colored plastic. It is given a matte finish and is designed to last long enough to become your best friend while using your earphones. A pair of 2 clips weighs a mere 8 grams. It may also be used as a fashionable accessory, usable in your everyday life without damaging your style.

Basic colors:


Key functions of The StereoClip:

  • Holds your phones to your clothes, pockets, bag etc. not allowing them to fall on the ground;
  • Holds the phones cable stretched so it doesn’t bounce around when you move, run, ride bicycle etc.;
  • Has a unique fashionable design;
  • The StereoClip is extremely light thus not stretching the clothes and not obstructing any movements.

Risks and challenges

With a product that consists of only one piece, the main challenge is producing the basic tool for our manufacturing – molding matrix. This is important moment because the whole production depends on the tooling. We have arranged meetings and spoke with main manufacturers of such equipment and manufacturers of plastic products as well and every single one of them ensured us that the preparation of such instruments and equipment can be done in up to 14 weeks time.

The second challenge is the quality control of the production and the materials. We have taken the necessary steps to ensure that our manufacturing and supply partners offer the preparation of a molding matrix, initial tests, material suggestions, excellent quality and compliance with the necessary legislative requirement for the production of product such as The StereoClip.

Another challenge is the size of our order. With larger orders the production cost can be reduced due to economies of scale. The fact that the product is a single piece will facilitate the production of additional quantities in short periods of time but will however delay the production a bit. This delay is taken into consideration while developing our plan.

In any case we will duly inform all our backers on the progress of the project and when to expect the product.

What We Will Use the Funds For?

We need $14,500.00 to reach our goal! We will use this money to pay for the tooling, molding, cover the cost of The StereoClip campaign perks, and pay for packaging, marketing and advertisement of this cool product as well as all the administrative costs related with the legislation. You can see the planned distribution of funds on the picture below:

Stretch goal: $ 20 000 – We will add some cool new colors in order to match different lifestyles and personal desires. They are selected taking into consideration the main colors of popular accessories – phones, cables, MP3 players, etc. and will be:


Why You Should Back Us?

  • The StreoClip is really awesome little accessory that you get used to with very quickly. Once you start using it you can find new applications to this cool clip and never worry again for the bouncing cable or falling down earphones.
  • As a backer, you will naturally get exclusive emails about the progress of The StereoClip. We will also give you a behind-the-scenes look at our production process and expected delivery dates.
  • You will earn yourself a fine perk – The StereoClip itself. Trust us, it will change the way you move with earphones on.

Our time plan

FAQ

Does The StereoClip support any type of cable?

Our current design fits almost all cables of earphones – single, double, round and flat up to 2.5 mm thick. We are planning special design for thicker cables once we reach our target so stay tuned!

Does The StereoClip fit on any cloth?

The clip is currently designed to fit on most of the materials. However it is not suitable for materials thicker than 4 mm or thin slippery materials as we cannot guarantee it will hold upside down without falling.

Do the perks include shipping?

Shipping is free only to Bulgaria. Transport charges for all other countries are calculated automatically when you add a perk. The couriers and postal services we have contacted promise delivery within 5 to 20 days for all destinations.

Backers are responsible for import duties and taxes if any. These are different depending on each country’s import/export legislation.

Do you ship worldwide?

Yes we do, see the previous question.


If there are any changes concerning The StereoClip, we will communicate these changes to our contributors in a timely manner.
